text: Butelka. Piwo uciekło z butelki. Nieco metaliczne, suszone owoce, ogólnie pustawko.
Bottle from Saveur biere. Pours caramel Brown with frothy white head. Aroma is honey, toffee, brown sugar. Flavour is a grainy brown sugar. Toffee with a light sugar wet finish. Lovely.
Big sweet malty nose with tons of orange bread, dried raisins. Malty thick. Good stuff

Recently tried this on tap at the North Coast restaurant/pub in Ft. Bragg and was immediately impressed. It has a nice ale aroma and the flavor is fantastic: rich, complex, not too bitter. Everything seemed perfectly balanced. For an ale of this ABV that isnt Bourbon-barrel aged, it is a true stand out.

Originally rated on 2/12/09. 2008 vintage, most folks reccomend aging this one and i think they are probably right. Although pretty good it was a bit hot, because the alcohol; while not overbearing was noticeable. Flavor had huge sweet caramel malts, plenty of dark fruits in the aroma and flavor such as raisins, dates and some plum. Overall it was pretty nice but i would like to cellar one and try it again next year.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Cukier i potworny, wódczano-rozpuszczalnikowy alkohol. Dramatycznie złe.

Thanks Huhzubendah for sharing the 2011 bottle! Poured into a snifter showing translucent caramel brown with no head. 

The nose is brandy forward. 

The palate is light bodied and moderately carbonated. Medium alcoholic spiciness, slightly cloying without much dimension.
Can believe im just rating this. Ive had a vertical from 1999-2015. Pours amber dark color. Taste is a nice sweetness with lots of malt backbone.

Bottle from 2012. Pours a coppery color with off-white head. Dark fruits, fig, caramel sweetness, bread, and some cereal on the nose; follows onto the palate. Full bodied. Finishes with dried fruit and caramel.
How: bottle Appearance: dark copper, small white head. Aroma: spice. dried fruits, caramel, nuts, grass. Palate: full body, soft carbonation.
A fantastic beer in every right. Pristine ruby color with a cream colored head of foam. Mellow vanilla, rich caramel, and some dark dried fruti and stone fruit in the finish.

Brown color. Thin , off-white head. Dried fruits, caramel malt and wood in aroma. Same flavor. Malty taste with warming finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 fl. oz. Bottle. Vintage 2015. Pours with a dark copper and a small tan head, which disappears quickly. There are some floating particles in the glassware. very nice nose: malty, raisins, Banana and sweetness cherries. Syrup and belgian yeast.very fat! Taste is toffee, raisins, some nuts, nice malts and caramel-woody finish. Full bodied . very good one!

Bottle 12 fl.oz / Bier-Bienne (CH). Vintage 2016. Garnet-bloody beer with a short and fleeting beige head. Liquor-like and powerful malted aromas, raisin, toffy, slight woody. The taste is like, very soft and syrupy with raisin, pruned, date, toffee-caramel, walnuts. Finale on alcohol, but without heaviness. Its all in the measure, without dominance nor weakness. Perfect balance, high art.

Bottle 33 cl. Vintage 2015, Consumo preferente 12/2015. Amber, hazy with a minimal offwhite head. Aroma of sweet malt, oak and caramel. Ligth bitter with a warm alc and wooden caramel ending. Nice apertif before reindeer fillet.
Dark burnished bronze colour, with aromas of fig, date, raisin, ginger, tea, sweet toffee, caramel, & some cut grass. Sweet with very smooth mouth feel; full bodied, with drying finish. Delicious!
Bottle from Liquor Barn into a snifter. Aroma has lots of caramel malts, some fruits, noticeable but pleasant alcohol.

December 2016 - Bottle from my stash shared at LKS Towers. As North Coast Old Stock Ale, 11.8%, 2014 vintage. Pours a ruby red hue, foamy tan head, dotted lacing. Aroma is red berry, fig biscuit, sugary. Body is a bit frothy, tingly carbonation. Taste is sugary, spicy, booze, red berries, varnish harshness. Too harsh for my taste. (3.1)

Vintage 2015. Elegant verspielt und unfassbar sweety erdig STARK. Breitbrust mit üppigem Big Beer Korpus. Rosine & Brotkruste sind auch an Bord...GANZ GROSSES KINO. 2 Cellar Bottles here ;)......4,50. Rattys Fäschchen....

Bottle.

A- Dusty, whisky, boozy, oak, dark fruits.

A- Garnet color, clear liquid, beige head.

T- Booze, butterscotch, prunes, dates, fig, oak, whisky, dusty.

P- Full body, slightly thin texture, average carbonation, complex finish.

O- With just over 3 years of age on it, this 2014 vintage was time to open. As much as I wanted to keep saving it, I couldnt wait any longer. Somehow still boozy but a really nice sipper. I honestly liked it a touch colder than after it had warmed.

Piana żółta, średnio oczkowa i średnio trwała. Barwa miedziana, mętna, z pływającymi drobinkami. Aromat głównie słodowy, karmelowy, są też akcenty toffi, melasy i orzechów laskowych. W smaku jest sporo słodyczy, karmelu, ciemnego miodu, suszonych owoców, marcepanu. Goryczka niska, migdałowa. Niskie wysycenie, średnia gęstość, dość ładnie wkomponowany alkohol, co dodatkowo zwiększa odczucie lepkości, wyklejania, likierowości trunku w odbiorze.

Bardzo klasyczny, (mimo że z USA) tradycyjnie angielski Old Ale, wydawałoby się nudny i nieciekawy, ale to właśnie taka interpretacja do mnie trafia najbardziej...

From notes. Bottle shared with ebone1988, Gus, and Aaron at Gus Birthday V2. 750 mL bottle, 2012 vintage. This is the Otsuchi bottle. The pour is a lighter brown honey color with a thicker off white ring of head and no lace. It looks pretty thin and light. The aroma is pretty decent. There is a light graininess, a strong oak, a hint of alcohol, and a light dried fruit. Its almost like a barleywine. The flavor is much of the same. There is a distinct grain happening with a light caramel and a hint of fruitiness. Its boozy and it begins to dominate as it warms. The mouth feel is lighter and thin with a sharper carbonation and a lingering caramel alcohol on the finish. This is decent, but not really what I was hoping for.
12 oz bottle pours hazy amber with a off white head. Aroma of dried fruit, wood and caramel. Taste is malts, toffee and fruit
Bottle, 2016. Light brown colour, hazy, small head with decent lacing. Aroma is toffee, a bit of wood, alcohol (not disturbing). Good, but not very interesting.
2014 bottle at home. Pours hazy amber with medium sized beige head. Aroma is caramel and dried fruits. Taste is sweet malts and caramel.
Brun klar farge med luftig beige skum. Lukter av maltsødme og søte tørket frukt. Medium kullsyre og medium fylde. Bittersøt avslutning.

(355ml 2015 bottle from Systembolaget) Pours clear copper, with a small stable off white ring of bubbles. Aroma of caramel, toffee, Maillard flavours, toasted grains, sundried tomatoes, nuts, some booze. Flavour of caramel, alcohol, toasted grain, dried apple, lots of booze. A bit thin, average carbonation, and alcohol heat. Decent enough but distractingly boozy for its malt depth and body. Better as a beer to age in barrels than on its own.

355ml bottle, 2015 vintage. Semi-clear shiny brown with one finger beige head. Sweet malty aroma with dried fruits, toffee, light wood, light orange peel and caramel. Taste is caramel, toffee, sweet dried fruits, some woodiness, light alcohol warmth and dry yeastiness. Smooth yet filling mouthfeel, light carbonation and sweet malty aftertaste with pleassant alcohol warmth.

Malty intense caramel, grain aroma and taste. Some dark fruit notes. Very thick texture, with some alcohol warming. Very unpleasant suspended coagulated residue was not sedimenting after months of standing. Intense gushing.

2015. Gylden brun klar med høyt beige skum søm fort blir helt borte. Lukter trevirke, brent malt og noe svisker. Middels fylde. Brent sukker, tørket frukt, vanilje og trevirke. Middels bitterhet og sødme.

Bottle (2016). Dark ruby color with off-white head. Aroma has dark fruits, oak, malt, caramel, raisins. Taste is malty sweet with long a bit sweet aftertaste. Flavors of nuts, malt, raisins, wood, plums and other fruits. Some nice alcohol warmth too.

Bottle shared at Leightons place, 29/12/2016. Many thanks to Daniel for this one. Aroma is rich ruby red coloured pour with a fine off white head. Aroma is sweet toffee, jammy fruits, raspberry, cranberry, brown sugars, liquorice. Flavour is composed of seet layered malts, toffee, brown sugars, liquorice. Palate is medium sweet, moderate carbonation, woody. Good.
UPDATED: DEC 29, 2016 Botella 33cl, Tercer Tiempo Tienda (Santander) Cerveza oscura con un fuerte olor y sabor alicorado, no es mi estilo lo cual no quiere decir que no sea una gran cerveza
2010 A: Light hazy brown coloured N: Raisin, apricot, raisin T: Raisin, hint of liqourice, caramel O: Quite complex. Nice!

Dec 21st 2016 just opened a 2007 Old Stock Ale. An inch of latte-coloured head after almost ten years! Still a light sweet palate with a hint of dried fruit, but much drier than nine years ago.. Traces of licorice in the end. heavy body could be a replacement for port to heavy framage affiné...

2016 Vintage. Barwa ciemno brązowa, wpadająca w miedzianą, ładna, długo utrzymująca się piana. Przepyszne, mocarne piwo. Nuty suszonych owoców, rodzynek, toffi. Mimo swojej mocy, bardzo gładkie, aksamitne, a jednocześnie pełne wrażeń. Świetne piwo.
A bottle on Black Christmas 2016 at 12 Kings. Vintage 2013. Aroma is malty, molasses, fruity, slightly sour. Taste is very sweet, bourbon, dark fruits. Slightly boozy. Good stuff.

0.355 l bottle from Bierkompass, 2014 vintage. Clear, very deep ruby with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, off-white head. Sweetish, malty and quite fruity aroma of raisins, prunes, candied cherries, toffee and vanilla. Rather sweet, very malty and slightly fruity taste of raisins, prunes, vanilla, toffee and candied cherries, followed by a medium long, slightly bitter, moderately warming-alcoholic finish. Medium to full body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very nice, not as deep as expected or hoped, still quite hot, a bit too fizzy as well. Nevertheless a satisfying sipper.

4-pack from Willows Market in Menlo Park, CA (2016 Vintage). Aroma is boozy Creme Brulee, raisins, caramel, hazelnuts, some herbal liqueur. Taste is boozy (but not overpowering), caramel, raisins, roasted nuts, some spicy herbal yeasts. Carb is super soft and creamy. Su-perrrrrb!

Thanks to Chris for this beer! Vintage 16. Bière en-deçà de mes atte tes qui je dois ladmettre, étaient pour une raison que jignore, bien hautes. Robe entre le rouge et le brun pourvue dune fine tête qui se résorbe en ne laidsant quun mince anneau blanc cassé. Beaucoup de sucre au nez; un sucre dorge qui ne me convient pas. De la figue, du sirop fe canne. Cest annonciateur dun liquide difficile à boire pour moi. En bouche je ne ressens aucune complexité. Le liquide ne propose que des saveurs à mon goût fades et sans intérêt de sucre de canne. Je ne décèle rien dautre. Grand manque fe complexité, cette bière se trouve certainement dans le top-50 de son style en raison des brassins précédents qui je lespère, furent de loin supérieurs à celui-ci.

Tap; pours dark brown with thin white head; aroma of malt, dried fruits, caramel, and a hint of vanilla; taste is light sweet with caramel, fruits, malt, and a touch of vanilla; dry, alcohol warming finish

Bottle. Vintage 2015. Thanks, Harri! Reddish-brown mahagony colour. No head. Berries, sweetness, caramel, toffee in the aroma. Slight bitterness, herbal notes at first. Berries, some spices in the middle. Berries also in the end. Dry, white wine like finish. The bubble in the middle is very similar to prosecco. Texture makes the taste of the berries even more powerful. Rather medium bodied, rather low carbonated very good old ale with very plesent and interesting mouthfeel.

Bottle, 2015 vintage (from some webshop). Pours dark red amber. Aroma is sweet, caramel, malt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, caramel, fruits, malt. Alcohol is mostly covered. Carbonation is on the high side. Overall: very good.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, dried fruit, chocolate, nuts and roasted malts.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque dark orange/brown beer with a slight/medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, dried fruit and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with nuts and roasted malts.
br />
Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Does not manage to be super remarkable with its flavours, but still tastes great.
0.355l bottle. Hazy orange body with a beige head. Aroma and taste of orange zest, caramel, roasted malts, orange zest and booze. Nice beer.

I look forward to this brew every year. I poured a bottle of the 2016 vintage into a Sam Adams Utopias glass, which is the perfect vessel for this sipper. It pours a reddish-brown, which is gorgeous to admire when back-lit. Minimal light tan head with virtually no lacing on the glass. The aroma is subdued, yet teases well what youll be tasting: molasses, brown sugar, caramel, toffee, raisins, prunes, toasted coconut, vanilla, cocoa . yes, I realize this sounds like Im describing an ice cream sundae! The flavor is all of the above with a mellow boozy burn that slightly singes the nose hairs, thanks to its 11.8 percent alcohol. The mouthfeel is like crème brûlée on the tongue; a silky, slick, chewy texture. The bottle gives sage advice: age for at least a year to develop even further character and taste characteristics.

Bottle, Vintage 2014. Reddish amber color with beige ring. Aroma is raisins, chocolate, figs, booze. Taste is more raisins, sirupy, sweetish booze, warming finish. Fine-bubbled, low-to-medium carbonation. Very nice traditional-feeling brew (I would say Barley Wine, although its not as sweet as many other Barley Wines)

(bottle) slightly hazy ruby-amber colour with a creamy beige head. aroma of baked apple and caramel, with some light brown sugar, musty perfume and cherry juice. flavour is mostly brown sugar and treacle, slightly ethanolic, with a lots of caramel, some black bread crusts and a light roasted-bitter finish. heavy-bodied with soft carbonation.
Dark amber with little white head. Aroma is cherry and lots of caramel, raisins. Lots of caramel sweetness, phenolic stuff. Heavy, oily, Good stuff.

Slightly hazy amber color with beige head. Aroma has dark fruits and brown sugar. Taste follows with dried raisins, bitter burnt sugar, earthy hops. Medium to light body, medium bitterness, quite dry. A well made old ale but I think its too bitter and earthy for the style.

2014 bottle from Jonno for my birthday. Cheers! Aroma is marzipan, dark fruit, nutty, light booze. Taste is good, subtle, fruity again, nuts again. No hint of booze, which is a little scary. Rich and fruity. Tasty.
2015er Flasche. Leicht trübes rot mit wenig Schaum. Malzig, süßlich, Karamell, fruchtig, Pflaumen, Rosinen, alkoholisch, leicht würzig.
notes are vague; will re-rate. caramel nose; of course not as complex as the bbl version but basics are there from the bbl beer.

25.10.2016. 0,355l Bottle. Vintage 2016. 11,8%. Systembolaget. Dark brown colour with almost no head. Unclear and kind of murky. Aroma of dark malts, wood, alcohol, red berries and plum. Almost with notes of wine. Strong and bery rich. Sharp with notes of terpentine. Aftertaste is malty with rich flavours of dark malts, alcohol, red berries and wood. There is also some faint notes of whisky. Not very bitter. Very good!!
2015 Bottle. Brown with small head. Cocoa and caramel. Dark fruit. Loads of depth. Not that boozy for the abv. Very well done old ale.

2016 vintage, 11,8%. Bottle from SB. Brown/red/copper clear color with onefinger white head. Aroma is caramel, bread, brandy, toffe, wood. A hint of booze in aroma. Heavy sweetness with light bitterness. Medium body with creamy and sticky texture. Soft carb. A sweet old ale with malty and bready tones, a bit too boozy right now, probably will be better with aging.
Bottle a red brown colored beer with a white head aroma malts fruits dried fruits spicy yeast and hops flavor malts fruits dried fruits spicy oak caramel some alcohol and hops in the aftertaste

Bottle thanks to Bursprak for picking up :) Pours hazy dark brown with a small light brown head. Aromas of nuts, caramel, warming booze, chocolate, vanilla, light bread, malt, dates. Taste is malty, bready, nuts, dates, toast, caramel, booze. Pretty delicious!
Fatastic beer! Enyoy With reponbility! Smoth, mild and dangerus.

Bottle ; 2014. Pours a deep coppery color with a white, fully diminishing head. Big smokey aromas with wood, malts, bourbon, raisins and caramel. Taste is sweet and malty. Bourbon, wood, liquorice, caramel and smoke. Full bodied with quite high co2 levels. Nice, but definitely a sipper.

2012 bottle thanks to Rubio. Pours a reddish brown clear color with a thin white blanket of head. Cardboard and caramel notes. Mollases, spearmint, anise flavor. Medium mouthfeel, medoum sweetness. Very good.

Old Stock Ale 2016  
 Alkohol:  11,8% obj. 
 IBU:  34 
 Data butelkowania:  14.12.2015 
 Kolor:  Miedziany, wpadający w brązowy. Piwo jest lekko mętne. 
 Piana:  Spory gushing spowodował, że piwo wylewało się strumieniami z butelki.
Piana była lekka, wiotka i niezmiernie szybko pękała do wąskiej koronki.
Miała kolor żółto-kremowy.
Po zakręceniu Tumblerem tylko nieznacznie podnosiła sie do góry.
Na krawędziach punktowe znaczki.
Słabiutko w tej kwestii.
 Zapach:  W aromacie cud, miód, malina i powidło śliwkowe. 
Spore utlenienie w postaci aromatu miodu wielokwiatowego.
Dalej duża porcja karmelu i gorącego toffi.
Jest także mnóstwo odnośników zapachowych do owoców takich jak jabłka i gruszki.
W oddali może nawe kapka mlecznej czekolady. 
 Smak:  W smaku wyraźnie miodowe, potem karmelowe i na końcu owocowe.
Te same owoce co w aromacie (jabłka i gruszki), plus dodatkowo brzoskwinie.
Prócz tego lekkie herbatniki, toffi i muśnięcie czekolady.
Prócz tego cukier trzcinowy i rodzynki.
Oleiste, gęste i dobrze wyważone.
Alkohol rozgrzewający, ale nie dominuje.
Pozostwia w ustach wrażenie nalewki owocowej.
Nieźle pijalne, ale czegoś tutaj brakuje i z pewnością nie jest to jak dla mnie topowe Old Ale... 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Piłem kilka duuużo lepszych Old Ale.
Ta butelka, którą miałem miała spore utlenienie w postaci dużej dawki miodu wielokwiatowego.
Poza tym przywitał mnie konkretny gushing.
Piwo jest dość oleiste, chociaż też nie jest to jakiś mistrzowski poziom.
Alkohol rozgrzewa, ale nie przebija się na zewnątrz. Przy 12% alk. to i tak spory sukces.
Niby wszystko gra, ale w rzeczywistości brakuje mi tutaj balansu.
Po North Coast Brewing Company spodziewałem się prawdziwego kozaka, ale trochę się zawiodłem.
Amber colour, medium lacing. Aroma resembles brandy. A full bodied beer, with strong flavours of caramel and toffee cultimating in a long finish. Very good.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking an Old Stock Ale (2016) by North Coast Brewing Company at PowiśleBrytolskie BW takie, slodkie, alkoholowe, mega duzo suszonych i kandyzowanych owocow, syropowe, nieco karmelowo-orzechowe. BdbOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Vintage 2016. De color ámbar cobrizo, con una corona de espuma color marfil de buena retencion, con burbujas compactas y abiertas. En el aroma destaca el dulzor, notas a caramelo, toffee, algunos frutos oscuros maduros, madera, en boca es similar. Retrogusto ligeramente dulce con un amargor medio bajo no astringente.

Bottle, 2016. Pours dark amber, quite clear with small white head. Aroma offlowers, herbs, caramel, toffee, grapes, wood. In taste sweet, malty with caramel, flowers and dried fruits notes. Full bodied, oily, softly carbonated and smooth on the palate. Finish is medium to high bitter with pleasant, warming alcohol. Great brew.
Bottle. Color amber/caramel with small white head. Aroma dried fruits, caramel, alcohol, winy. Taste sweet, dried fruits, caramel, alcohol.

hazy dark amber to brown colour, moderate sized, creamy yellowish-beige-ish off-white head; aroma of herbal liqueur, floral-honey notes, some burnt sugar, woody notes, some grape and dried apple hints of anise (?) and minimal spicy alcohol; taste of herbal liqueur, syrup and burnt sugar, dried fruits, medicinal bittery notes and significant amount of alcohol; really special beer - more like a liqueur with beer-ish notes than a beer :-)

Aromat umiarkowany, przypomina mocne belgijskie i angielskie piwa. Jest chleb, karmel, nieco melano, czekolady, orzechów i nut drożdżowych (w stylu quadrupla). Sporo alkoholu (rum?) i nutki ala drewniane.

Wygląd: barwa głęboko miedziana do czerwonej, wyraźnie zmętniona, z pływającymi drobinkami. Piana beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, niemal kremowa, umiarkowanej wielkości i podobnie trwała, ale przy takiej mocy to do wybaczenia.

Smak: dość wysoka słodycz i spora dawka alkoholu. Nuty karmelu, czekolady, melano, suszonych owoców. Goryczka powyżej średniej, wzmacniana przez alkohol. Zdecydowanie tęga pełnia, raczej niskie wysycenie i słodki lekko słodowy finisz z z wyraźną nutą alkoholową rozgrzewającą przełyk. Jak dla mnie bardziej belgijskie niż angielskie. Być może złagodniałoby z wiekiem. Spodziewałem się więcej.

AROMA-Medium malty, bread, caramel, maillard, molasses . High alcohol feeling.

APPEARANCE-Light brown. Clear, little hazy. Tan head. Legs from the high alcohol.

FLAVOR-Medium-high malty sweetness with caramel and light chocolate flavor. Light fruity. Medium bitterness. High alcohol. Balance is malty-sweet. Aftertaste is high alcohol, light malty.

MOUTHFEEL-Full body, rich. Medium-low carbonation.

OVERALL-Strong. Complex.

Tämän oluen heikoin osio on ulkonäkö. Punertavan ruskea olut hyvin niukalla, beigellä vaahdolla. Tuoksu kypsän hedelmäinen ja karamellisen makea. Alkoholi tuoksussa yllättävän vahvasti esillä. Maku vahvan täyteläinen, karamellinen, hedelmäinen, lämmittävä. Alkoholi ei maistu. Ei juurikaan hiilihappoja, täyteläinen kokonaisuus, mutta ei yliampuvan makea. Toimii.

2012 vintage 750ml from AirForceHops, shared by Chalumeaux. Thanks, guys! Pours murky dark brown with a light beige head. Aroma is toffee, raisin, cinnamon. Flavor is toffee, banana, molasses, raisin, cinnamon, clove.
Poured from bottle 2012 thanks Airforcehops reddish brown with a thin beige head. Aromas of caramel honey roasted nuts grape and oak. Taste is dark fruit bread caramel and alcohol.

Bottle. Hazy hazelnut brown with a medium sized diminishing tan head. Nuts, caramel, syrup, honey, warming alcohol, dark dried fruits. Full body, lots of sweetness but balanced by alcohol. Long warming finish. Fairly sweet and alcoholic.

Vint. 2015.
Superbe.
Nez très complexe et équilibré. Beaucoup de caramel, de mélasse, un fond noisette, un peu de cognac, de résineux, de pomme confite, un léger fond dalcool. La bouche est finalement assez fine, très peu éthylique. Attaque caramel fumé, un peu grillé avec des notes de noix et noisettes. Des notes plus franches de cognac et dépices.
Magnifique équilibre et bel complémentarité.
Sweet molasses nose. Dark Amber, mild head. Sweet molasses with hint of citrus sweet cover and finish of honey. Thick mouth feel. Very good. Kinda lack luster for the hype

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2016 Bottle, vintage 2015. Dark amber, no head. Strong malt flavour. Caramel, chocolate, dried grape, alcohol, wood. Wine-ous at nose. Light bitterness, moderate sweet. Strong carbonation. Really owes the name of Old Ale. Could fit to wine lovers
UPDATED: SEP 24, 2016 Dark amber color, slight haze. Sweet malt aromas, caramel, ripe fruits. Caramel taste with fruits, vanilla. Warming alcohol finish. Solid.
opaque amber color with a thin tan head that goes away. aroma is caramel, dark fruit, and yeast. Flavor is caramel, raisin, leather, and booze.

355ml bottle from Systembolaget, vintage 2015. Deep mahogany / ruby, several small particles in the glass. Small tan head that disappears quickly and completely without leaving lacing. Sweet malty aroma, dried fruit, raisins, red apple, toffee and marzipan. Full-bodied, chewy, smooth and medium carbonated. The taste follows the aroma warm and sweet. Red apple, figs, dates, caramel, vanilla, sweet licorice and caramelized sugar. Warming bourbon notes in the finish.
Mörkröd /bärnstensfärgad med smutsvit skum som snabbt försvinner. Doftar och smakar russin, torkad frukt och karamellmalt. Ganska endimensionell

Dark reddish color with an off-white head with short duration. Aroma has notes of burnt caramel, sweet malts, some dry fruits as well. Flavos is slightly sweet, no cloying, good maltiness, caramelish notes, dry fruits with a good presence of alcohol. Slightly sweetness in the final with some fruitness and caramelish hints.
Taste of a 355ml bottle 2016 version 11.8% at Beer Station, Xiamen courtesy of Lulu. Pours hazy golden amber with a minimal head. Aroma of malt. Sweet finish. Mild alcohol.

Bottle from SB 160603. Vintage 2015.
Pours a garnet/amber with a very weak beige head. Sweet fruity nose with raisins and dried fruit over molasses and malt. The palate is too alcoholsweet. Rather unbalanced. Should have been aged more, perhaps. Orherwise nice flavours. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice Belgian-esque flavour to this full bodied, high alcohol beer. Nothing off, very caramelly, with the other main flavours coming from the yeast.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle (2016) from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep dark brown beer with no carbonation and medium brownish ivory head. Smell: strong caramel malt attack. Really sweet, notes of brown sugar and wood nose. Very intensive nose. Sweet and caramel domination. Taste: full body with caramel attack. Caramel malt, bread notes. Very intensive and toffee presence. Good attenuation. Really sweet finish and small alcohol notes. Aftertaste: caramel toffee and sweet caramel malt with alcohol presence.

355 ml bottle 2016 at abv 11.8% bought at HK Brewcraft in Central.
Looks: Translucent amber brown colour; Less than one-quarter finger head and soapy beige foam which fades in 30 seconds; Fair sticky lacing with barely notable slight carbonation.

Aroma: Fragrant Amber malt, with strong Port wine, cellar musty, brett-like barnyard, caramel, toffee, chestnuts, dark fruits, floral, sugar, yeast and grass. Pretty complex!

Taste: Strong, nicely sweet Amber malt, with strong liquor-ish alcohol, liquorices, strong dark fruits, strong assorted yellow fruits, caramel, toffee, vanilla, strong molasses, yeast, lemon, quite strong bitter hops and grass.

Body: Close to full body, Very slick and creamy palate.

Mouth Feel: Amber maltyness is strong but not overtly rich. Slick and pretty smooth throughout. Just when you think the booze will taste like the strong Brandy-ish Belgian Ambrée, it is much more restrained as light liquor (hard to pin down a style) with kust the right amount of liquorice. So nice! Ample caramel and toffee with mixes dark fruits and apricot-like yellow fruits. Sweetness is strong but as all molasses and highly enjoyable. Slightly yeasty with nice strong lemon to round. Lovingly subtle and layered!

Booze: Besides the nice light liquor-ish taste, the 11.8% is not aggressive at all, quite well-hidden and not demanding to go down. Excellent!

Hoppiness: Floral and grass in nose. Lemon and grass in taste. Bitterness combined with liquorices comes on an abrupt, mid to high astringent sweet fruity finish.

After Taste: Slightly dry. Nicely sweet and fairly liquorish-bitter to mouth.

Comments: I thought this one could be a Brandy bomb like Bush Ambrée or Bush de Noël, yet the aroma is Port-like with some brett influence, taste is subtle liquor with complex fruity and caramel, very comfy and undemanding booze, and nice hoppiness. Aging it will certainly do more wonders to this tasty Ale. Highly recommended!

Brune rubis limpide.Col de mousse se réduisant au minimum, balc cassé, beige clair.

Nez caramel, tonneau, acidité de tonneau, amertume.En tout cas : fa-bu-leux.

Bouche : de la force, une puissance inouïe mais beaucoup de douceur aussi, alcool présent, un caramel élevé en tonneau, belle complexité se terminant sur des notes amères.

Un superbe Barley wine, catégorisé Old Ale mais je ne sais pas à quoi cela correspond vraiment.Bon !

PS : Goûtez la XH de chez Kiuchi, cest bon et proche !
750-ml bottle from brewscafe. malty caramel nose, good head, good body, malty, caramel, quite sweet. rating #1!

Amber/deep red color with a little off white head. Looks nice. Aroma is subtle of sweet candy but with depth and complexity. The taste is sweet. Notes of figs among other things. A distant roastyness to the finish. Good tasting beer!
Copper color with small off white head. Aroma of malts, caramel, biscuit, black fruits, wood. Taste of candy, sugar, caramel, malt. Medium body and low carbonation. Bitter aftertaste.

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2017 Mixad recension. Tidigare druckit en relativt färsk 2015 (då rate:ad 3,9). Nu även testat 2015 och 2011 jämte varandra, i början på 2017 (den äldre flaskan har passerat bäst före-datum med ett halvår, enligt svensk märkning). De färskare har en mörkröd/mahogny klar ton i färgen, medan den äldre är mer murken mörkbrun, smutsdisig. Från litet vitbeiget skum till knappt något alls. En riktig maltbomb. Stor söt doft av torkad frukt; russin, plommon, johannesbröd, aprikos, övermogna äpplen. Även syltade körsbär, bränt socker, syrlig kola, honung, kandisirap, mörk bröddeg. Med några år på nacken framträder mer brända toner, lite mer "matt" sötma och lite "pappriga" toner av blöt kartong, ungefär som väntat. Stor, riktigt tung kropp. Oljig. Den äldre var näst intill slät, knappt någon kolsyra kvar. Håller sig nära doften i smaken. I de färskare framträder även en något bitter ton som växer till sig i avslutningen. Annars lite sträva ekfatstoner som bidrar med en lätt syra, lite konjak- och rom-toner och ett lätt humlebett i avslutningen med som är välkommet. Mycket kola, kåda och bränt socker. Alkoholen värmer på ganska bra. Återigen mer "matta" malttoner och brända inslag i den äldre flaskan. Håller väl för lagring, men grundölen når ändå inte riktigt upp till toppskiktet. Balanserar mellan 3,9-4 i betyg, men väljer att vara generös.

Golden amber pour with small off white head. Aroma of malts, caramel, ripe fruits, grains and hops. Taste of caramel malts, belgian candy sugar, apricots, prunes and hops. Full bodied, lower carbonation, beautifully balanced, great beer!
UPDATED: SEP 21, 2016 APPEARANCE: Amber color with a small head. AROMA: caramel, dried fruits and alcohol. TASTE: reflects the aroma. PALATE: medium bodied, low carbonation and low bitterness.
vanilla, woody, caramel, bread, toast, toast, brown, hazy, tan foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,

Bottle @ home. 2012 vintage - cellared. Pours a deep amber liquid with a stable medium sized, tan head. Aroma is like opening a bag of candy - fruity sweet. Slightly vinous with dark fruits and loads of sweet maltiness, carmamel, toffee. Hints of milk chocolate. Warming alcohol. Taste is similar with a big body and great duration. Residual sweetness lingering throughout. Flavor is moderately vinous and has notes of dark and red fruits, caramel, toffee,alcohol, syrup, sweet candy, biscuits, spices.
Vertical tasting with a young 2015 bottle: Its reminiscent but with a quite distinct grainy character in comparison. Its fruity and sweet but without as much intensity and mellowness gained from the sweet candy/caramel/toffee character (which is so nice) in vintages if this beer.
Brown, slightly redish liquid with off white head. Aroma is mainly bread to me. Smooth, but rather anonimous taste. Not bad, but definitely overrated.

Bottle at tasting. Copper orange color. Aroma of sweet malt, raisin, grain and ripe fruit. Thick taste of sweet raisin, caramelised malt, toffee and ripe fruit. Bit like a barley wine. Not bad, could use some aging.

Bottle of the 2015 from the Great British Beer festival 2015. Third beer from this brewery and each one has been magnificent. This is listed as an old ale, but its profile feels more towards a barley wine. Colour is murky, rich reddish orange. Deep rusty with off white beige head which dissipates to nothing. Nose is sublime. Big fruity, particularly dried apricot, stewed plum, prune, pear, barley sugar, ripe fruit. What a joy to have a big American ale which is not cloying with pine and citrous fruit. Taste is ripe fruit, prune, plums, apricot, slight citrous bitterness, tangy fruit, raisins and sultanas, fruit bready. Deep, rich fruity beer. Stunning. Congratulations to the brewers. This is excellence.

Bottle from andersons. 2015 vintage. Nose is malt and dark fruit. Body follows and is smooth with mild alcohol bite. Flowery and dark sugars like molasses mix in for a good balance. Look forward to Trying these one a year.

12 oz 2015 bottle allowed to warm for about 25 minutes then served in a Porter Bar goblet. 

Aroma: complex mix of various dark dried fruits, fruitcake, and hints of toffee.

Flavor: similar to the aroma; good complexity and balance. Sweet for style, leaning a bit towards a barleywine. 

Feel: full and smooth but with more alcohol heat than optimal. Light but appropriate carbonation. 

Overall: excellent; clearly I ought to get more and age it a while.

2016 vintage (11.8%) 
It pours dark amber/brown with a thin yellowish head. Aroma is lot of malts and some ripe berries. Taste is of a classic English strong ale, very malty, sweet, bready and boozy, no hops. Full bodied, low carbonation, A slow sipper, nearly a barley wine. Excellent.

2011 vintage that i got as a throw in on a trade. aroma is grape and wine. flavor is really smooth, some grapes and malty sweetness. no bite for a 12% ABV beer. nice pickup on a trade. pours reddish orange witha a thick tan head. had out of a 12 oz bottle

3oz sample at Cervefest 2016. Mahogany with a small white head. Aroma is of nuts, caramel, firewood and alcohol. taste is bitter with a somewhat bittersweet finish. Medium bodied with some carbonation and astringency.

3oz sample at Cervestfest 2016, 2015 edition. Clear maple/copper with a minimal head. Sweet malty and fruity aromas with hints of toffee and alcohol. Robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Moderately sweet and intensely bitter, with a deep malt character into a stinging fruity and alcohol finish. Heavy, complex and very pleasant.

Had 2002 (bottle) and 2006 (keg) before in a distant past. This is for the 2015 bottled version. Clear copper to brown color. Off white, quickly receding. Aromas of berries, sweet, fruit soda. Retronasal its sweet berries, toffee, fruit candies. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet. Strong alcohol feel. Rather full bodied. Long finish with no new flavors. I remember this as having a bit more depth, but it might be my memory is playing tricks.

Aroma is caramel, toffee, malt, booze, very nice. Appearance is brown, tan head, poured beautifully. Taste is caramel, toffee, slight booze, very malt, sweet but not overly so. Mouthfeel is medium, slightly watery, caramel aftertaste, light carbonation. Overall, this is a pretty tasty old ale.

Un vino de cebada tradicional y delicioso. Maltas y lúpulos británicos que combinan notas a caramelo, cereales, frutos rojos y frutas maduras con un final sutilmente amargo y con presencia de notas licorosas desde el principio del trago.

0,355l bottle at home from trade with Nische, big thanks. Vintage 2011. dark brown color, small tan head. smells strongly of dried fruits, raisins, some plums, berries, light cherries, spices, light sweetness, quite nice smell. full body, medium carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of dried fruits, plums, raisins, light berry notes, some spices, nutty, marzipan, light oxidation. finishes lightly dry with some alcohol and notes of dried fruits and some almonds / marzipan. a bit alcoholic, but overall quite nice sipper.

2015

Heavy malts on the nose. Strawberry twizzler, toffee, no hop aroma

Clear, dark Amber color, off white head leaves quickly

Very sweet malt, candied red fruit, slight bitterness on aftertaste

Slight carbonation, medium to med full bodied. A little oily 

Delicious, a little one note, would love some more carbonation but maybe not indicative of style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Red, ruby hue, clear, small non lasting beige head. Aroma is of dried fruits, sugary-candy, caramel and toffee, raisins. Taste is very sweet malt, caramel and toffee, some brown sugar notes, dried fruits, raisins, bit woody notes, some alcohol and warmth, light herbal bitterness. Full bodied, soft carbonation, sticky.
(bottle 2015, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte)

12oz bottle poured into a teku glass. A leather aroma fades and is quicky replaced by caramel, rum, and raisin with hints of mild citrus, and sweet, rich maple syrup. It pours a murky, oily, deep, dark raisin brown with fizzy, unstable tan head that shows very light retention and no lace. The taste is highly sweet with a medium bitterness. 
The texture is chewy with airy and fizzy carbonation. The medium full body has flavors of rum, raisin, caramel, mild citrus, spice, and wood that finishes woody boozy aftertaste booze wood dry with flavors of raisin that are strong at first, but doesnt last long and leaves a clean, dry chalky mouthfeel with boozy caramel.
Light malt smell and taste with a general light beer taste as well. Medium body, medium carbonation, and mild foam.

2015 edition. Poured on 02.17.16. A: Maple syrup, peach, malt, pear, and white grape. Very fruity. A: Fizzy white 1 1/2 finger head that recedes to a solid, but thinner layer. Hazy dark red/brown body. T: Follows the nose. P: Slightly astringent, maybe slightly oily, but hidden by bubbles. O: Its very interesting all around. The alcohol is hidden well and the flavors are deep and complex.

Birra spettacolare, dallaroma e dal gusto intensi. Note liquorose e alcoliche dominanti, benché la birra non vada mai alla testa. Poi caramello e maltato, nonché frutta sotto spirito. Birra che scalda e appaga!

Poured from a 2015 bottle. Pours a deep caramel brown, like iced tea, with a thin tan ring. Light carbonation. Caramel, toffee, and light malt aroma. No harshness or alcohol burn. Full mouth feel with a smooth warm finish. Very enjoyable.

12 oz bottle. 2015 vintage. Cant believe I havent rated this yet. Aroma is fruity (cantaloupe?), bready, chocolate. Pours muddy brown-orange with a collapsing beige head. Taste is sweet and savory with flavors of sherry, raisin, cola. Thinner than expected. Nice beer.

355 ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Clear dark red copper ruby color with off white head. Malty aroma, caramel, fruity, red and dark fruits, dried fruits, alcohol. Sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation

9 year old bottle (2007) pour dark amber with a small off white head. Aroma is toffee caramel sweet and smooth notes. Flavor brings the same toffee but a bit more tangy and boozy, but not harsh. Had the 2010 and 2014 as well which were good, but not as smooth.
Dark ruby colour, off white head. Aroma of caramel, figs and cherries. Taste is medium sweet, medium body, sticky oily texture, soft carbonation.
Sabor bem maltado e doce. Os 34 IBU passam imperceptíveis e o álcool também desaparece. Muito equilibrada. Excelente.

2012 Vintage.
Hazy dark amber/ruby with a beige head.
Aroma has loads of figs, fudge/toffee/caramel, alcohol, brandy.
Taste is sweet and spicy with figs fudge/toffee, herbal bitterness, slight chocolate, perhaps coffee as well.
Full body, low but prickly carbonation, a bit numbing and dry mouth feel.
Bitter, numbing after taste.
Solid Old Ale that I keep coming back to.

Raisin caramel malt aroma. Deep brown color with a light tan head that doesnt last long. Heavy raisin fruit malt taste. Mild bitterness. Feels thick and rich. Has a boozy feel. It may be rated high but this isnt my style despite wanting to try this for quite awhile.

(bottle) 2014 Vintage, cellared for 17-months. Pours a light brown complexion, slightly murky with dissipating head, no lacing. Aroma is rum-raisin and alcohol. The flavor is a concentrated rum-soaked raisin, fresh figs, prune and dried orange, malt and alcohol.  Alcohol burn in finish. A real winter sipper.

Pours a dark clear red colour with a tan head. Sweet malty smell, also fruity and alcohol in the smell. Has a smooth taste of raisins licorice and also herbs. the mouthfeel is pretty thick with a nice bitter after taste. This is a lovely beer strong in alcohol but smooth in taste

Deep ruby head, small rim of white head. Aroma of dried fruits (fig, plum), caramel, brown sugar. Flavours of drieds fruits (more fig, plum and raisin), caramel, alcohol fusel. Medium warm dried fruits. Oily body, medium carbo. I should get more and age them.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle:Deep chestnut-amber coloured, almost clear, small and quite stable off-white foamy layer; solid sweet-bitter nose of raisins and further dried fruits plus caramel plus mild traces of alcohol; moderate to solid sweet-bitter flavour, full bodied, not so soft; caramelly and - as expected - fruity finish balanced by some dry hops. A bit alcoholic, but nevertheless a pleasant winter-warmer

12oz bottle 2014 vintage pours dark hazy brown red with light edges and a finger of head. Nose is gingerbread, maple, cookie, gingersnap, date. Taste is toasted maple nut bread, some caramel, malty dark grain bread, bitter with some dark fruit sweetness. Finishes bitter, medium body with a touch of creaminess, earthy nut, date, walnut, caramel, malt.
Bottle @ New Years Eve 15. Oily bronze pour with some tiny lacings. Notes of sweet malts, biscuits, caramel, booze, vanilla and some earthy notes.
12 oz. bottle. 2015 Pours brown/reddish, off white head. Aroma was berries, fruits and raisin. Taste was slightly sweet and alcohol, but not lasting,

355 ml bottle, 2015 vintage, from Beervana Munich.
Dark copper, hazy body, with a quite small, fizzy, creamy, beige head.
Aroma of caramel, toast, dark berries, dried fruits, brown sugar, some spices.
Taste is quite boozy, with caramel, cocoa, dried fruits, berries, toast, honey, some coffee.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes roasty, medium dry, warm, alcoholic, with toast, cocoa, coffee, some caramel, some fruits.

Very nice. Interesting fruity notes, combined with sweet and roasty notes. Pretty boozy, maybe a bit too much. Overall not my favourite style example, quite different to others Ive had, but a really enjoyable winter warmer nonetheless.

2014 Version

L:
-pours a clear red-brown with a small to medium,quickly dissipating,foamy,offwhite head
-low carbonation visible
-small particle floaties visible
S:
caramel,toffee,nutty,figs,strawberrie chocolate,brown sugar

More a Barleywine than an Old Ale.
Very good, but also very sweet
Fantastic! Great taste and a nice full feeling in your mouth with a nice finish. This is certainly one I would try again.

Pours deep copper with a quick off white head. Nose is sweet and a little boozy. flavor explodes with barley and bread and is quite sweet with a long sticky finish.alcohol is present but well hidden. Great beer

Refrigerated 12 oz. squat brown poured into snifter. Translucent reddish brown with small beige head. Aroma is caramel malt, medium/thick body, lower carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is caramel malt and hints of alcohol.
Cola bruin bier met een kleine witte schuim kraag. Ruikt rood fruit, alcohol, pruimen, tabak. Smaakt rood fruit, vanille, alcohol, siroop.

Klasszikus karakter hordozója, réz színű főzetünk minden ízében a hagyományok itala. A vékonyka habgyűrű már az alkoholfok mértékének tudatában sem meglepő, eleve örömteli, hogy egyáltalán van. Fűszeres illatai gyógynövénylikőrök karakterét villantják meg, akácméz és fahordó, bogyós gyümölcsök téli hangulata járja át a levegőt. Cukrozott paradicsomlés, fenyőgyantás, komló és maláta súlyától roskadozó ízvilága tagadhatatlan brit mondanivaló megnyilvánulása; pikáns jegyei klasszikusan elegáns, sokszínű és izgalmas tartalom kinyilatkoztatásai. Csakúgy, mint maga a műfaj, az Old Stock Ale is izgalmas és semmihez nem fogható, igazi különlegesség.

A little towards the sweet and yeasty side. ---Rated via BeerBuddy for iPhone.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark red brown in color, extremely minimal carbonation, tiny white circle of bubbles throughout. Smell of wood, cask, berries and fresh bread, wheat and clove. Taste is hugely wood, medium sweetness, complex balance of sweet and bitter, definitely one to savor.
Pours a dark hazy copper color with a thin tan head. Aromas of caramel and malt. Taste the same with some alcohol warmth. Nice flavor. Thick palate. Nice lacing in the glass.

2015. Pours golden brown color with off white head which leaves a slight foam coating on the beer. Aroma is sweet like candy (caramel/vanilla toffee) and slight cherry. Somewhat light body with a slight stickiness. Complex and fantastic flavor. Drinks really easy for @12%. Nicely done!

12 oz bottle of 2012 edition, poured into a nonic pint at ~40 degrees F.

Appearance: Pours a hazy, vaguely reddish brown, and forms a thin head of beige foam that rather quickly turns into a ring. Leaves patches of lacing on the glass.

Smell: At 3 years of age, the aroma is a bouquet of sweetness and malt, very caramel and molasses. Fig, plum, date, and the like swirl around in the scent as well, alongside a vague hint of booziness that seems less rum, more whiskey.

Taste: All the sweetness in the nose did not lie. This opens in a wash of dark stone fruit preserves slathered on bread and topped with molasses. A medicinal quality comes in as the beer moves along the palate, much like Id imagine an early 19th-century cough syrup might have tasted like. Rusted iron notes appear as well, giving a metallic tang to shadow the syrupy sweetness, and there are bits of a burnt caramel-vanilla tone. An oaky and vinous tinge round out the flavor palate, and the aftertaste lingers as the molasses, preserves, and medicinal syrup.

Mouthfeel: Sticky is the first word that comes to mind, with minimal sharpness from carbonation rolling through a full-bodied beer.

Overall: A delicious old ale / English barleywine, which ages quite well.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2016 This is my second time enjoying a bottle of 2013 vintage Old Stock Ale. I look forward to trying the 2014 vintage. I am quite impressed with North Coast Brewing Co! This Old stock ale is excellent. The only score I didnt top out was appearance..this one is a nice coppery color though cloudy. There is a very nice sweetness and absolutely no bitter at all. This combination will never fail to win me over big time. (9/25/2016) Enjoyed a 2016 bottle. Quite smooth and enjoyable even with the high ABV If memory serves, I believe the 2013 bottle was a bit sweeter than this 2016.

330ml bottle. Pours deep amber with a little off-white head. Aroma is malty, caramel, vanilla, brown sugar, sponge cake, alcol. Flavour is medium to high sweet with a decent bitter end, complex, light astringency. Full body, medium carbonation. Very good.
Bottle. Woody toffee malt, cherry, and hay aroma. Hazy orange-brown color with small head. Sweet apple/cherry, toffee malt, and bitter hay/alcohol flavor. Body kind of light.

Rousse. Fin collet. Très sucré. Caramel. Fruit sec. Datte. Raisin. Légèrement boisé. Fine chaleur d'alcool. Banane. Finale toffee. Excellente. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

North Coast ships its hops from England when brewing its annual batch of Old Stock Ale, which shows its dedication to crafting an English Style Ale. However, its the use of said hops that creates a uniquely American ale. Old Stock has a fair amount of earthy bitterness mixed in with the rich grains. Before I get too far down that trail, Old Stock pours ruby red with a thin layer of foam - not surprising given the ABV being just shy of 12%. Aroma has dark and syrupy fruits. Flavor has bread, fig, date, plum, prune, cherry, toffee, butterscotch, and mild citrus. The full-bodied mouthfeel contains stickiness and some crispness coming from the hops. Old Stock has some serious class. Id love to try a version with even more age than the 2014 vintage.

12oz bottle bb10/2019. Amber-acajou pour, fast receding small foam. Sweetish toffee, barley cereal, faint Sherry cask and vinsanto notes interlinked paratactically: complexity here is not yeast-driven, but layers of grain sweetness stacked on top of each other. More barley sugars, honey, apple syrup and vinsanto sweetness manage to remain dry but very literal: astounding for a nearly 12% beer how easy to drink, yet how literal and under-complex this beer remains, lessening the appeal to take repeated sips. Candied citrus, pine, pear drops come through to make clear this is a doublehopped US barleywine. Hides its booziness well, but does not offer a need to indulge in its rich caramels. An infant in complexity compared to 7% Brakspear Triple or Gulden Draak. Made to age, not to sample young?

Hazy honey color with an off-white head. Aroma sweet with lots of raisin and fig notes. Taste sweet, full, and boozy. With notes of dried fruit, figs, and raisins. This is very much a sipping beer as it does not hide its alcohol well. However, in that capacity it is quite good. :)

This 2013 version pours an opaque brown. The nose carries a strong bourbon aroma and the 14% Abv. is certainly present with each warming swallow. Great great sipping bear and aged nicely after 3 years. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from 3er tiempo online. Dark red, copper, brown. Beige thin head. Medium high sweetness, medium bitterness. Flavour is vanilla, hops, malt, chocolate, liquorice, wood, dried fruits, citric fruits.

Bottle. Pours burgundy brown with very thin head that lingers at the glass. Mild boozy aroma over light carbonation. Boozy caramel flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with MrHangover. Clear red color, medium sized quite quickly diminishing a bit fizzy beige head. Aroma is malts, nice fruityness, dark fruits, caramel. Taste malts, caramel, dark fruits, balanced sweetness. Alcohol well hidden, very drinkable, very balanced, good body and soft carbonation. Very nice.

Bottle 2015 vintage, courtesy of Benzai. Pours a clear amber beer with a quickly disappearing off white head on top. Aroma of mostly red fruits, caramelized malts, slightly booze. Flavor is very sweet and fruity with a nice alcoholic backbone. Aftertaste is very boozy and sweet with soft carbonation and a light sticky mouthfeel. Very nice!

(bottle, 35.5cl, vintage 2014) Slightly hazy, copper to brown colour with a beige medium-sized foamy head. Slightly buttery caramel-malty aroma with nutty notes, sugar, subtle fruity accents and a whiff of alcohol. Sweet flavour, full bodied with a soft carbonation. Rich malt character with notes of caramel, butterscotch, pistachios, also subtle fruity accents; sweet malty and slightly bitter finish with a lasting cornucopia of flavours and a warming alcoholic strength. Very good. 22.IX.15

12oz bottle - 2007 vintage. Reddish-brown hue w/some finings and a tan head of moderate height. Sugared date & fig nose. Boozy - almost like it was BBA. Tasty: aged fruit & caramel. Full body and nedium+ carbonation.
In Bar Viriato, Sevilla. In wine cup. With Viriato Burger. 5?. Pleasantly warm. Really nice in aroma and taste. To drink with care because of its high ABV

Taste Vintage 2009 on August 2014. Sweet and malty aroma with hints of nutmeg and spices. Pours a medium cloudy brown color with a moderate head. Goes down smoothly expanding on the sweet aroma with an almost bourbon flavor. Just enough carbonation without being too strong. Full body with strong flavor. One of the better beers Ive had.

Bottle. 2014 vintage. Pours a murky reddish brown. Off white head. Smells of caramel, butterscotch, malts, some alcohol. Tastes similar. Moderately sweet followed by a moderate bitterness. Medium bodied; average carbonation; lasting, lightly bitter finish.

33cl bottle served in a snifter. Clear dark tan colour with a few bubbles but certainly not enough to constitute a head. Aroma is just sweet shop sweetness - caramel, toffee, sugary sweetness. If ever there was a beer to submit you into a diabetic coma this would be it. Flat taste profile with just varying levels of sweetness offered. Very disappointing as I am a massive fan of Rasputin from the same brewery and thought I would give this a shot. I ended up giving over half of it away. Disappointing.
Pours muddy brown and smells like dark berries and rich malts. Tastes rich and sweet, with caramel, plums and even some coffee on the tongue. Quite a complex and high octane beer.

2013 .33l bottle @Vihreä Haltiatar. Pours murky brown with low head. Aroma is dark malts, caramel, syrup, coffee notes, alcohol, plums. Flavor is caramel, malts, syrup, alcohol, plums, some milk coffee. Swell, warming beer.

2011 bottle from own cellar. Deep clear red brown color. Beautiful. Fizzy head that disappeared quickly. Aroma is rich berries, raspberry, lingonberry, caramel, sweet plums. Nice sweet and complex. Taste: berries, candy, caramel, malty, thick mouthfeel with some alcohol there. Very nice!

Bottle pour murky orange brown with rapidly dissipating head. Nose dates, raisin, caramel, sweeter character. Taste again, raisin, caramel, slight minerality. Late palate light alcohol. Light spice and caramel again in the aftertaste.

Bottle @ Bishops Arms, Gustav Adolfs Torg. Vintage 2013. Minor gusher. Hazy reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dried fruit and alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily. 110715
2013 bottle split with Dave during an episode of GoT. Malt foward, not too sweet, stout influence definitely there. Nice.
33 cl bottle from systembolaget bs. 2014 age. Pours amber with little head. Sweet caramell aroma with sweet toffee and caramell taste. Long aftertaste with some alcohol.

Good fizzy head that dissipates after a while with a copper color. High alcohol is evident from the start, but is very well behaved. Tastes of cotton candy, burnt caramel, and here comes the alcohol. Oh boy, really great beer, well balanced. A must to have several in your private stash.
I have never rated beer before, but I thought this was great. I smoked a pipe while drinking it and enjoyed it a lot.

Raisin aroma and color. Some peanut brittle and an odd ripe to rotten strawberry flavor. No alcohol taste but you feel the burn down the pipe in the end. Slight sweetness and yeasty. Lots of sediment in there and I havent even had much of the bottle. 2013 vintage in bottle.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2016 Bottled on 1/7/2016. Big caramel aroma; some candied orange,toffee, and vanilla as well. Taste is very caramel forward, followed by vanilla, toffee, slight plum and berries, then bitter at the back of the tongue and booze burn when swallowing.
Solid beer...borderline barley wine....flavors are all over the place...really nice...(#515)

Versión 2015. Caoba rojizo limpio y espuma canela ligera. Aromas de frutas confitadas, mermelada de frutos rojos. Cuerpo denso y meloso. Sabor dulce de mermelada de inicio, con final de amargor seco y ligeramente astringente.

Bottle 35,5cl / Botella 35,5cl. Vintage 2015.
@ XXXII The Great Power of Beer & Wine.
A: Amber / Ambar.
T/S: Malt, alcohol, sweet, slightly fruity / Malta, alcohol, dulce, ligeramente afrutado.

Bottle from Rudat in Dortmund. The beer has got a deep amber-vanilla colour with a small head and smooth body. Aroma of malt, hops, cake and rum. Taste of barley, mild hops, malt, caramel, nuts, ripe fruits, cake, rum and barrels. Smooth to drink, delicious brew.

Die 2014er Version war es. Und die hat was auf dem Kasten gehabt ! Schoene Balance diverser Aromen wie Kaffee, Milch, Honig, Roestmalze und etwas Getreide. Sehr sueffig fuer diesen Alkoholgehalt und die Staerke wird hervorragend durch eine feine Suesse ueberlagert. Klasse.
No overwhelming flavor, nice and balanced on malt and flavor throughout. Very nice mouthfeel, creamy. No heat from the alcohol.
Great aroma. Sweet fruit after taste which seems hide the dryness youd expect in a 12% beer. Really pleasant, really complex flavors. Very enjoyable.

Bottle from The Drinkery, Derry NH. Aroma is strong--could smell it from over a foot away! Smell is complex of malt, fruit, alcohol, yeast. Appearance is beautiful, clear, dark red amber with champagne-like sparkling. Mild, 1/2 finger width creamy off-white head with nice crackling sound from a distance. Pretty insignificant lacing. Taste is moderately sweet with fruity sense and only the mildest alcohol detected at the end (pretty well hidden 11.9%!). Palate is velvety creaminess, medium bodied with carbonation that gives it backbone until zippy kick at the tip of the tongue at the end. Finish is wet and moderately long fruitiness. Overall, there is soooooo much to like about this beer for all of the senses! Hard to find much fault.

2012 Old Stock Ale consumed on 4/16/15. Very hazy body. Looks sort of like a barleywine. Big aroma of dark fruits. Lots of raisin and plum flavor. Has the mouthfeel and maltiness of a barleywine. Pretty darn good with a few years on it.

2015 Vintage, aroma i gust a dolços, recorda sobretot a caramel i amb un toc anissat.
2015 Vintage, aroma y sabor a dulces, recuerda sobretodo a caramelo y con un toque anisado.
Pours dark honey/burnt orange color. Aroma of brown sugar, caramel, anise, raisin. Flavor of caramel, molasses, brown sugar, vanilla, touch of anise. A sweeter beer, but well balance.
Flaska från 2012 från systembolaget. Underbar doft av dadlar, fikon och russin. Liknande smak med lite värmande alkohol i bakgrunden. Mycket god!
Old stock ale 2013 a clear Amber with a big fruity aroma. The nose is fruity and boozy. Med-full bodied. The taste is oaky, vanilla boozy sweetness. The taste is oaky sweet vanilla.
Aroma of dark fruits, taste is dark fruit, malty, sweet, alcohol is well balanced, very good!
Bottle at Biercab. Copper colour with small off-white head. Malt, caramel, dark fruits aroma. Sweet, malt, caramel, wood, dark fruits taste. Medium to full body.
Botella. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 11/04/2015. Batch: ZBNCOS1. Color ámbar, Aroma a caramelo. Cuerpo Alto. carbnonatacion baja.

355mL from Slowbeer 2014 vintage
Pours a deep hazy copper body Small dense creamy head persists.
Aroma is HUGELY malty - toasted nuts, brown toffee, butter caramel, sultana & dried fig, even more toasted nuts (somehow!?), vanilla, slight woody whisky undertones.
Lovely & rich on the palate - syrupy, chewy, yet not cloying, low carbonation.
Oh yeah! This is a showcase of BIG malt flavours - toasted nuts, sweet biscuit, toffee & caramel, raisin, sultana, dried fig, vinous black fruit undertones. Good bitterness, lingers, but oh so smooth on a long warm finish.
This is top notch! Old ales dont get much better than this

Color is a beautiful reddish brown. 
Nose has a sweet malt with cocoa, red fruits and some dark fruits that remind me of cognac. 
Taste (new 2015 batch) - Smooth malty goodness with good carbonation. A tad of bitterness on the mid palate but the fruits and malts balance throughout. Finishes fairly clean with just some light malt to chew on. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012.
Context. Without it your rates, ticks, or whatever you want to call it has no value. Comtext cannot be forced and great beers cannot be properly assessed or enjoyed in a night of assembly line ticking where speed and
quantity are all that matter.

North Coast Old Stock Ale is case in point. Understanding it requires time. And focus.It sparkles and has the most gorgeous reddy brown colour imaginable. Totally restrained and yet with great structure supporting a spirity this gloriously orangish brown beer is meant to be savoured over time. Old school and proud of it, this beer is the perfect antiethis for everything which is wrong with the modern craft beer scene.

12 fl oz bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 07-04-2015.
BBD: Dec 2015. Vintage 2015 (if this makes any sense...)
In short: malty ale.
Pours hazy copper with little off white head. Short head retention, poor lacing. Ripe fruit, caramel and some solvent like aromas. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste is smooth, sweet, caramel, fruity, but some off ones, a bit dry and little harsh.

2014 vintage on tap: Pours honey gold with thin creamy head. Aroma is malt with some fermented fruit. Taste is sweet and covers the alcohol well but not overbearing. Mouthfeel is incredibly smooth for a >10 abv beer... unbelievable.

2014 bottle from cellarbrations super store in hami hill. Pours murky amber with a thin disappearing head. Body is full with low carbonation. Aroma is intense. Boozyness is very evident but is slightly masked by sweet burnt sugar, toffee, nuts and dark fruits. Taste is just as complex and amazing as the aroma. A sugary sweetness begins the palate which then develops into port. The finish is slightly bitter with a very warming hit of booze at the end of the palate with flavours of dried nuts, sultanas and apricots remaining as an after taste. Great beer

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2016 2009 bottle, 11.5%. Cherry-port nose giving way to a caramel chocolate. Sweetish, slightly raisiny, heavy velvety body. Just enough bitterness to balance the sweetness and body. Great strong ale.

2015 Bottle - 11.9%. Pours brown/dark amber with a slightly off white head. aroma is light caramel, some sticky pudding, dark figgy fruit. Medium body, lightish carbonation. Theres mostly sweet stuff - caramel, light burnt sugar, light treacle, dark raisiny, figgy fruits, rum, coke, booze... Its fine, the booze is a bit harsh but theres some nice rich flavours too.

Brown bottle, 12 ounces, 2007 vintage, savoured on March 10 2015; eye: mahogany, hazy, no effervescence, tiny ring of beige head, no lacing; nose: toffee, malt, slight hops, slight Madeira, fig, light molasses; mouth: toffee, malt, slight hops, slight Madeira, dig, light molasses, finale in malt with presence of caramel, medium-full body, mildly sweet, syrupy texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 12 onces, millésime 2007, savourée le 10 mars 2015; il : acajou, trouble, pas deffervescence, minuscule anneau de mousse beige, pas de dentelle; nez : toffee, malt, très léger houblon, très léger madère, figue, léger mélasse; bouche : toffee, malt, très léger houblon, très léger madère, figue, léger mélasse, finale en malt avec présence de caramel, corps moyen-corsé, carbonatation sous la moyenne, moyennement sucrée, texture sirupeuse; en résumé : bien

2002 vintage : A dark brown ale with a thin light mocha head. In aroma, sweet caramel with dark dried fruits, maderized, light licorice, nice. In mouth, a sweet fruity caramel malt with loads of honey, surranated hops, licorice, molasses, maple syrup, alcohol warmth, oily mouth feel, interesting but a bit tired. Bottle from GRM, merci Sylvain.
Bottle from stirchley wines. Copper beer with residual head. Aroma of malts and sweet syrup. Taste is sweet syrup, malts and caramel with a hint of spice. Good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared with SarkyNorthener cheers Martin; hazy dark copper pout with a thin beige head, sweet caramel aroma, taste is very sweet with some woody action, dark fruit, light bitterness. ABV present.
Bottle. Cherry, other fruits, and caramel in the aroma. Nice sweet brown sugar and caramel taste with a boozy slightly bitter burn in the finish. Very tasty!

A deliciously subtle barley wine! Pours amber w/ a thin tan head that leaves a tiny ring of lacing. The aroma is mainly sweet malty goodness. The taste is phenomenally smooth at 12% alcohol! Its nearly full bodied & malt heavy. There is a small punch of bitterness towards the finish. This is an excellent barley wine!
Bottle at Craigs. Pours copper amber, nose is roasty, toffee, taste is sweet toffee, bit oxidised.
Malty smoky aroma. Reminds of whiskey. Brown reddish color. Sweet taste and a little boozy.

12oz bottle -2013 vintage - pours a deep Amber color thin off white head . Sweet dark fruit aroma . Loads of caramel and figs .., hints of vanilla . Very nice . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaska från 2010 från SB. En riktig favorit som funkar riktigt bra att lagra. Söta fruktig smaker av honung,torkad frukt, russin, madeira, toffee. Välintegrerade smaker, ingen alkohol eller sötma som sticker ut men fortfarande full av kraft. Komplex. Riktigt riktigt got

355ml b (thanks Anna parents) 2009 vintage. Hazy dark amber color. Small size, yellow head, stays. Sweet, menthol, caramel, cakey notes in aroma. Toffee, mint, malty, berries, raisins in taste. Sweet, cakey aftertaste. Honey-like mouthfeel. Alcohol is very well hidden. Nice one.

Bottle at home, 2011 vintage. Pour is murky caramel colored with a small eggshell head and decent lacing. Cherry skins, toffee, caramel, somewhat bready, sweet dates, plums, and brown sugar in the aroma. Taste is bready, caramelly, sweet cherries, some raisins, brown sugar, grapey, tangy, and cookie malt with a light alcoholic finish. Thick mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Not bad, but the barrel aged version is much better.

355ml bottle (Beertopia, Nebraska) thanks Annas parents! 2009 vintage drunk 2015
Where have my previous 2 ratings gone!?!? Nice roast aroma, cakey, dark bread, a little sweet, and some mint from the age. Does smell 5+ years old. Lovely full smooth palate. Soft sweet malty body, just a bit of caramel and toffee, but not sticky or sugary sweet. Retronasals are lovely, has that tempting cakey caramel. Finish beatifully roasty, a darker caramel than the taste. Covers the alcohol brilliantly, and doesnt just smother it with sugar. Dang, Ive sat on this for 6 years, It was worth the wait, but alas its now its over. Thanks Frank!

Bottle at 20 Springs. 2012 vintage. Pours amber yellowish brown with a thin off white head. Aroma is malty with slight dark fruits. Flavor follows and is pretty bitter, but with a nice maltiness. Slight booziness. Overall, a very nice beer.

2014 Edition. Pours a brown sugar color with a slight quickly diminishing light tan head. Smells like caramel and brandy. Definitely has some caramel malt and scotch booze taste. Theres also raisin and plum flavors. Thinner than I would like. Gets better the longer it sits. I will let one sit for a while before opening again.

Sweet and malty aroma with hints of nutmeg and spices. Pours a medium cloudy brown color with a moderate head. Goes down smoothly expanding on the sweet aroma with an almost bourbon flavor. Just enough carbonation without being too strong. Full body with strong flavor. One of the better beers Ive had.

12 fl. oz. bottle, 2014 vintage. Clear medium copper, vanishing off-white foam. Aroma is syrupy, sweet caramel, vanilla, boozy. Fairly intense, woody vanilla barrel flavor, quite sweet, caramel, malty, port-ish. Softer carbonation, full bodied, moderately hopped. Lasted almost 3 periods. DNFL (Definitely Not For Lagerboys)
Deep plum aroma, dark brown with thin head, wonderful complex taste with a long after taste, great...

2014 vintage. Pours a dark amber color with a small head. Aroma of dark fruit, maltand spice. Taste of dark fruit, raisons, bit of malt and hops in the background. Mild bitterness and a fairly dry finish. Medium body, smooth, with a rich flavor, very well balanced and just a bit of the 11.8% ABV peaking through. Will try this again after it matures a bit.

2013 bottle.
This was poured into a snifter.
The appearance was a nice looking dark brown color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within about a decent forty-five seconds. A nice trickling yet speckled lacing clung but ended up sliding into the beer.
The smell had a nice sweet to malty cinnamon and raisinous sticky slightly maple-esque conglomeration.
The taste, for the most part copied the smell and added a nice coating of a sticky sweet cinnamon and maple and a nice dark fruit (sweet plums).
The palate sat about a good medium on the body with a nice sessionability running under my tongue delicately yet smoo.
Overall, did I have this at the absolute best time? Hot damn, this is super good! Wow at least to me.

2014 fresh. Pours a light brown red with finger of head. Nose is caramel, a bit hoppy, a bit of dark fruity sweetness. Taste is a robust malt profile, caramel, bread, brown sugar, dried dark fruit (maybe prune, raisin, apricot), still a minor hop presence balancing it, a scotch/whiskey note also on the finish. Full body.
Nutty, toffee aroma. Pours wonderfully with decent head and nice lacing. Flavor doesnt have the liquor bitterness, but it does warm you going down. Nice as an alternative to sipping liquor.

2013 Vingage: Aroma is beautiful, sweet, grapes, plums and toffee. I actually catch a hint of rum in there. The taste is sweet from dark fruits but also carries a small hint thats almost a bit sour, maybe grape-like sour. Vanilla passes by really quick. Then the warming booze sensation takes over, but its not disturbing, more like supporting. This one is great, maybe a little thin in the body

12 oz bottle. 2014 vintage. Pours a reddish brown with lots of bubble but no head. Aromas of raisins, copper, dry caramel, toasted malts and alcohol. Flavors of dried dark fruit (a little sour), old oak, malt extract, and a bit of nuts. Subtle bitter finish with noticeable heat. A good big beer.

It pours brown with a light brown head. There are flavors of caramel and dried fruit. It has a smooth, creamy texture with dried fruit and caramel flavors and produces a pleasant warming on the way down. It has a sweet and bitter balance to it as well.

Bottled. Pours an amber color with a small mildly beige head. Aroma is hops, some lemon, lots of caramel, mild toffee, some vanilla, bit of bourbon. Flavor is caramel, some bourbon, toffee. Not a very hoppy Barley wine. Slight hop bitterness. Definitely malt forward. Not the best Barleywine, but a good example of the style.

2014 bottle. Slightly dark amber. Light tan foam that fades to a ring. Aroma is brown sugar, dark fruit, caramel. Slight hoppiness too. Taste is much the same. Thick, syrupy, warming mouthfeel. Carb quite high. Drinks pretty easy. Might improve with a few years on it; seems a bit simple at this point. Nice enough though.

2010 vintage Leicht trübes orangebraune Farbe, wenig beiger Schaum. Geruch nach sehr reifem Dörrobst, holzig, alkoholisch, Vanille. Geschmack mild holzig, Vanille, reifes Obst, leicht brennend alkoholisch, viel Karamell, leicht schokoladig.

average frothy offwhite head. fair lacing. mostly diminishing. dark amber flat thick body. aroma: moderate malt, raisin, light hoppy, alcohol. if: heavy sweet. ff: heavy sweet light bitter; long duration. palate: light medium body, watery/oily texture, lively carbonation and metallic moderate alcoholic finish. Amargorzinho de lúpulo balanceia bem o dulçor, sem macular as diretrizes do estilo. Frutas secas no paladar. Forte aquecimento alcoólico. 100s

2014 Bottle into a tulip glass. Pours a dark amber with a thin white head that quickly fades. No lacing. Nose is raisins and caramel, and the taste is the same, with the alcohol well masked. Probably would improve with some aging. Well balanced.

2014 vintage. Pours copper with no head. Aroma: caramel, figs, malty sweetness and plum. Taste: subtle caramel with dark fruits. Very balanced, an English style Barley Wine. Alcohol incredibly well hidden (no way it has over 11% ABV!). Interesting, but it will definitely get more complex after 1+ years. Need to get another bottle!
Mahogany with a bit of haze and a thin but persistent head. Aroma of caramel, figs and leather. Lots going on in the taste. Gotta love the complex.

Bottle, Vertical tasting with 2014 old stock, 2012 ostuchi, 2011 Brandy, 2009 Bourbon. All pour similar murky brown with the BA versions being fairly low carb. Aroma is dark fruits and taste is light bitter toasted malt, tasty beer

355ml brown 2010 years vintage brown bottle, rated 11.7% ABV, poured into a snifter glass. Appearance is hazy mahogany with a small tan head that dissipated quickly, leaving no lacing. Aroma of caramel, apricot marmalade and raisins. Flavours of caramel, apricot marmalade, toast, raisins, vanilla and oak wood notes. Taste is heavy-medium sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium-full bodied, slightly syrupy texture and soft carbonation. North Coast Old Stock Ale is a great Barley Wine. Balanced and mellow flavours with the alcohol being completely masked, perhaps due to aging this bottle 4 years.

12 ounce bottle. Pours a hazy brown with a thin light tan head that lasts. Taste is of wood, bourbon, caramel malt, vanilla, light smoke, fruit and some citrus. Similar aroma. Has a full body with a boozy finish. An excellent brew, that is easy to drink for its alcohol content.

2014 bottle. Pours a clear ruby/caramel with a ring head. Aroma is a mildly sweet caramel, and dark fruits. Taste is balanced. Bready caramel and dark fruits. Medium-high body and carbonation. Smooth texture with a home dry finish. Overall tasty. Would be good aged.

12 ounce bottle into snifter; 2012 vintage, bottled in early 2012. Pours slightly hazy dark ruby red color with a 1 finger dense khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a good amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big caramel, toffee, toast, raisin, plum, fig, apple, date, cherry, brown sugar, brown bread, and herbal/yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/bready malt and fruity/earthy yeast ester notes; with good strength. Taste of big caramel, toffee, toast, brown bread, raisin, plum, fig, apple, date, cherry, brown sugar, light nuttiness, herbal, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Light earthy herbal bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of caramel, toast, brown bread, raisin, plum, fig, apple, date, cherry, brown sugar, light nuttiness, and yeast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity and balance of dark/bready malt and fruity/earthy yeast ester flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and fairly full bodied; with a creamy and moderately slick/bready mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is fairly well hidden with only a small warming present after the finish. Overall this is an awesome old ale. All around great complexity and balance of dark/bready malt and fruity/earthy yeast ester flavors; and quite smooth to sip on for the big ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

Bottle, 2008 vintage. HUGE malty aroma. Mahogany color, with tight bubbles of an off white head. Tastes almost like it was barrel aged, but its just a great combination of malts. Full bodied. Very good beer!

Bottle. 2012 vintage. 

A: Mahogany color with reddish purple edges. Whispy creme colored head, some lacing. 

N: Raisin, fig, cola, cherry, some cocoa and caramel notes here. (They are buried underneath the dark fruits.) Bready with big tobacco and leather notes. Toast.

T: Big sweetness and a touch of bitterness underneath to leaven this beer. 

M: Resinous and thick body. Very light carbonation - just enough to keep this from becoming overly dense. Alcohol is very well-hidden. 

O: The 2012 vintage has aged very nicely. The cigar and barleywine note mix reminds me of sitting on my apartment porch and smoking a stogie after dipping it in a hefty beer of the same type ( I really need a synonym for barleywine. Double pale ale intentionally brewed? That seems too long.) This is a classic beer, and you can age it successfully if you have a mind.
UPDATED: JUL 10, 2016 355ml bottle. Hazy copper/brown body with a brief medium head. Sugar, plums, dried dark fruit, alcohol, vanilla, toffee and a hint of earth. Overall well rounded.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 330ml bottle served in a snifter glass.
2013 Edition.
A: Pours a dark amber to nutmeg brown forming a small light beige creamy head. Medium to low retention and only very few lacings left. A small layer remains for long time on top
S: Sweet and fruity. Strong notes of caramel, grapes and wood. Quite boozy. Earthy and bready
T: Sweet upfront. Again, strong notes of caramel and dark fruits. Mainly grapes and plums. Notes of nutmeg and oak. Quite molasses with a considerable presence of alcohol. Very malty and sweet, in overall. Smooth and pleasant, Ale. Some grassy hops can be felt and the end is light bitter
M: Heavy and molasses body. Low carbonation. Bittersweet aftertaste
O: Strong but quite drinkable. Very well done. My second North Coast after Old Rasputin. No regret, just pleasure...
[ BA Review @ 5/19/2013 ]
2012 Vintage. Pours a murky brown with a very thin head. Aroma is of concord grapes, caramel malts. Flavor is sweet caramel, boozy, slight grape. Finish is toffee and rich
Awesome brandy appearance. Alcohol is evident but if its the last one of the night the warming is appropriate.

Bottle of 2012 vintage. 
Dark brown, some head that disappears quickly but remains on the edges. Plums, dates, caramel, vanilla. Light sweetness, medium bitterness, full palate.
Alcohol hits pretty harshly but, well, thats what Barley Wines are. Its a strong one, perhaps aging would have balanced it out. Suits well as a night cap instead of the regular whiskey or cognac.
750ml bottle of 2012 vintage. Pours a pale yellow brown color with a bit of head. Malty but a bit of alcohol harshness. Slight molasses.
Mahoganyfärgad med snabbt försvinnande krona. Doftar bränd karamell. Smaken spritig och eftersmaken än mer alkoholanstruken. Eftersmaken lång, bränd kola. Nä, barley wine inget för mig.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2014 12 oz bottle of 2014 vintage from Whole Foods in Hillsboro, OR. Aroma has brown sugar, tart cherries, leather, and NyQuil. Mouthfeel is thick and robust, with a bitter, boozy, and slightly astringent finish.
Poured from a 12oz. This is not my style of beer. Aroma was a boozy sawdust. Not super pleasant for me. Taste was like a grape must spritzer. This beer did have a very inviting color to it.

Brown ale. Head gone after a few seconds only. Strong in alcohol. Flavor mainly sweet licorice, sweet wort and stale dry fruit.The aroma forces itself on me, syrupy, boozy, hoppy. Ive had better beers.

Bottle 2014 version. Reddish brown beer with a strong head. The aroma is rich with some roastedness, the flavour is very rich and malty with roastedness and a port like quality. Overall a reasonable strong ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from systembolaget. Smell of malts, bread, raisins and some berries. Pours dark amber with a small beige head. Deep taste, berries and some bread and raisins. Palate is full and round. Overall a really enjoyable beer.

Served on nitro-tap into a Bells tulip at Als of Hampden.


A - Pours nut brown with a very spotty tan head leaving no lacing down the glass.


S - Tons of rich caramel malt up front with a touch of booze. Some dark fruits like raisins and figs mix well with a bit of spice and strong brandy flavor from the booze. A very complex nose.
