T - Lots of caramel sweetness up front from the malt giving way quickly to lots of dark fruit flavors similar to the nose, toffee, and vanilla. Finish is strong booze that lingers on the pallet for some time. I liked this one a lot but I dont think I could drink more than one at a time. It is a very heavy beer.


M - Heavy body and flavor with moderate carbonation. A good amount of booze burn lingers for some time. I think the nitro hurt this one a bit.


D - Not too bad. I like this one out of the bottle better. I think if it was on co2 it would have been a bit better. Still one of my favorites for the style.

2014 vintage. Clear heavy amber pour with a huge dark ruby cast making it almost red. Good head, lacing and retention. The nose is dark fruits (plum, raisin and fig) over a faint caramel sweetness with moderate alcohol notes. Full bodied with a rich creamy texture. Average carbonation with a bit of effervescence on the finish. The flavor profile is loaded with complexity, yet well balanced. The 11.8% alcohol is very well hidden, but becomes more prevalent as it warms. It begins with a burst of caramel sweetness that flows into the dark fruit flavors, but the sweetness is never absent due to the heavy malt bill. Chocolate notes appear in the middle that relent to coffee/toffee notes. The finish is where the alcohol is most prevalent, leaving you with that nice alcohol burn at the back of the throat, but yet not overpowering. The finish is somewhat tannic with a touch of hops over a fading caramel sweetness. An outstanding Old Ale and a fine example of OCs brewing prowess.

9/VIII/14 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle from a trade @ home - BB: n/a, 2013 vintage (2014-899)Thanks to hackobock for the trade!
Clear red to dark amber beer, creamy yellowish head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of alcohol, caramel, bit metallic, banana peel. MF: soft carbon, full body. Taste: sweet, sugary, lots of alcohol, banana, sweet touch, vanilla, chocolate. Aftertaste: banana, bit sugary, milk chocolate, soft bitterness, sweet, something off, more milk chocolate. Good, but the B.A. stuff is much better. :-)

Drank a 2010 - 2014 vertical with my homie Asa. Rich complex caramel maltiness and deep ripe aged fruits. Booze was obvious in the newest version. Almost sherry like with bits of vanilla. It was a consensus that 2011 was the best, but this is certainly a beer that ages gracefully and works better with age than most beers Ive. Easy, cheap way to have a fun vert tasting.

Reddish brown colour with fluffy beige head on top. Aroma has spices, tannin, wooden notes and anise. Resembles a lot of sherry or cognac. Taste has tannin, wood, spices, berries and anise. But this is covered by a wave of alcohol washing through and making this beer a very hard to drink. Full body and medium-to-low carbonation cant save this one. A huge disappointment, not what I expected from Barley Wine at all.

Transfer from BA review on 2-28-13-
 Served on tap in a snifter glass

 Appearance  Served a mahogany colored brew with a one finger cream colored head. The head faded rather fast giving way to a persistent foam and a great level of lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma is sweet with a heavy toffee and caramel smell. Mixed with this aroma are smells of a dark fruit, roasted malt and a bit of nuttiness and vanilla. A bit of a boozy, rum like aroma accompanies all these creating a quite complex and warming smell.

 Taste  The taste begins with sweet flavors o toffee and caramel mixed with some roasted malt flavors. A light dark fruit flavor of cherry then enters the taste as well as a little bit of vanilla. Soon after these tastes hit the taste buds so too dose a mild oaky and nutty like flavor. Toward the middle to the end the booziness that was hinted at in the nose becomes known. In the end the now nicely warming and boozy flavor of the brew, when mixed with the sweet and roasted flavors leaves a rather sweet and toasty flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfell  The body of the beer is a little on the thinner side for a 11.9 % brew(but thick if comparing to an average brew) with a carbonation level that is on the medium to slightly higher side. A little less carbonation and more creaminess may have better suited the boozy and sweet flavors of the brew keeping it, as is more appropriate, as a sipping beer.

 Overall- A rather tasty and slightly boozy brew. The only thing really holding it back from greatness is the weak body, but otherwise it is quite fantastic.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2015 Bottle (12 Oz): cloudy reddish brown. Smells a little boozy and sweet, but well balanced. This is not a very hoppy brew. Very tasty and a new regular for me.
Update: Was 4.1 now 3.9.  Not enjoying it as much.

The 2009 vintage, with East Kent Goldings and Fuggles hops. Thin, off-white head, colour deep bronze. Complex aroma, temptingly perfumed with raisins, candied dates, pear syrup, cranberries, madera, sherry, chocolate, vanilla, liquorice... Rich fruity taste on a deep sweet, honeyish and caramelly malt base, full and vinous, retronasal all the good things from the aroma come back and further decorate the palate, hop bitter finish with nice warming alcohol. Very well-balanced, rich and elegant provision ale.

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Ariel. Clear amber with a nice head. Malty and alcoholic aroma. Sweet, malts, dried fruits and caramel, quite boozy. Medium-full bodied. Heavy but pleasant mouthfeel.

12oz bottle from 2013 drank aug 2014. Pours a murky, amber/brown with almost no head. Smells sweet,fruity, and fermented giving a sense of high alcohol. Heavy bodied with noticeable carbonation on the tongue. Bitterness from the malt nicely offsets the fruit flavors and alcohol taste. Well balanced and well done just like North coast. A little to fruity for me and Im not particularly a fan of barley wines. Still I would like to revisit this down the road and stock some bottles in the cellar as it ages magnificently.
June 2009. Clearish maroon with absolutely no head whatsoever. Very very sweet, without any hops to balance the malt. Not much of a finish. Pass.

Rödbrun vätska med obefintlig brungul skumkrona som försvinner snabbt. 
Doften är syrlig och frisk.
Smaken är kraftfull med markerad beska och stor kropp. 
Lite spritig i karaktären men inte påtagligt. 
En helt ok barley wine, men den vinner säkert på att lagras ett år eller två.

Pours a redish brown body with a thin head. Aroma of syrup. Rich taste of syrup and bread.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 0,33l. Vintage 2014. Pours an amber brown colour with a slight haze, one finger head that diminish. Aromas of caramelized malts, ripe fruit and alcohol. Ripe fruit flavors accompanied by raisin and bourbon, caramel malt and faint grassy hops. Full bodied, minimal carbonation, oily texture and a sweetness in the finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle in a hotel room in Las Vegas. Clear amber pour, thin white head. Aroma of spicy caramel malts, some alcoholic brandy and slightly earthy. Flavor is quite warming, spicy and a bit of red wine, some wood and quite earthy. Strange brew at first, but likable after a few sips.

#100 Barley WIne. 355 ml. bottle split by 3 @ Memorabel Tastingkje. Thanks to tderoeck! 2013 Vintage. GUSHER. Foam still rising from the bottle after we lost a fare share of it. Spare head, lightly hazy amber brown beer. Getting the usual barley wine notes in the nose, toffee, dried, fruit, caramel etc. but feels a bit thin & herbal. Taste is muted and bit thin molasses, cereal, toffee, dried fruits with some leather, broth, prunes, butterscotch leading into a thin, metallic, lightly herbal finish. Little carbonation, this one didnt feel all right, disappointing, prob. a lesser bottle. Only beer that I didnt really care for in an otherwise great tasting, oh well, it happens, glad I dot to try this one all the same.
I didnt like much about this beer. It was my first Barley Wine and I obviosly dont get the style. I guess if you like the style, youll like this well enough.
UPDATED: APR 29, 2016 Bottled. Pours brown with a small light brown head. Smells very nutty, caramell malt. Tastes alcohol, nutty, roasted malt, a bit cheese with a nutty dry mild bitter finish.

Bottle of 2014. Wow, its all here: fruity esters, dried fruit, caramel, molasses, toffee, treacle, with just the perfect amount of winey character. Beautifully balanced American barley wine style, with a long, long finish. Made in more of a traditional English barley wine style (meaning little or no hop profile) rather than in an American barley wine style (higher hop profile). Overall, a great English barley wine made by Americans!

Den var väl sådär. Funkar i brist på annat. Snygg flaska och hyfsat bra pris. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Vintage 2014. Pours a dark mahogany brown with an off-white, small head. Big aroma, loads of dried fruits, dark caramel, semi-dark chocolate, old wood and a hint of spices. Palate is quite full bodied, rather sweet, again with loads of dried fruits, some roasted malts and a medicinal hint. The finish lingers for a good minute. The bitterness is quite low in this one and not a whole lot of alcohol heat. Ive put two of these in my little "cellar", better go and get some more to put down for a few years. This is great.
Pours a hazy brown. Aroma is sweet with dark fruits and malts. Taste is dark fruits, bready, and has some alcohol in the finish.
(backlog) Bottle at a tasting at maxxdaddys. Not sure on vintage, we drank in 2011. Brown amber pour with tan head. Sweet, fruit, spice, touch of sherry and alcohol tones.

Amber brown with a slight haze, one finger head and sticky thin lacing. Aromas of caramelized malts, ripe fruit and alcohol. Ripe fruit flavors accomapnied by raisin and bourbon, caramel malt and faint grassy hops. Full bodied, minimal carbonation, oily texture and a sweetness in the finish.

2014 edition at barely legal tasting room 
Pours dark , brown , good yet fast fading white head . Smell is balanced yet intensely sweet . 
Taste is very nice , liquor-ish mouthfeel . Sweet , earth and bit bitter . . would have prefered a touch less carbonation . Nice !

355ml bottle from Beers of Europe, 2014 vintage. Pours clear copper-brown, no head. Aromas of calvados, brown sugar, strong herbal notes, christmas cake mix. Taste is sweet and boozy at first, giving way to nuttiness and more herbs. Oily texture, sticky finish. Not bad.

2013 vintage in 12oz bottle. Served at 48degs. The beer poured a cloudy caramel color. A thick foamy head persisted for about 15 mins. Aroma is molasses, fermented dark fruit, prune, alcohol and bread (the Maris Otter comes through!). Alcohol and vinous sweetness on the palate. A pleasant bitterness on the finish with a touch of oxidation. This is a big beer and it takes time to sort it out. Thick mouthfeel with a long long finish. Overall, nothing to complain about. It doesnt feel like there are a lot of silly spice additions to detract from the wonderful malt and the rich gravity of this beer. I have come to expect a lot from North Coast. This beer does not disappoint. Its a little hot. I have three other bottles that I will let sit another year. Then we will see if the alcohol has mellowed a bit.

12 oz bottle. 2014 offering. Pours dark honey/burnt orange color. Aroma of brown sugar, caramel, anise, raisin. Flavor of caramel, molasses, brown sugar, vanilla, touch of anise. A sweeter beer, but well balance. Quite a nice brew.

2014. Pour is dark red, almost a cranberry juice color. Minimal head that dissipates rather quickly and leaves a ring of foam around the edge of the glass. Aroma is raisin, caramel malts, sweet brown sugar, and a little bit of alcohol sweetness. Taste is big raisin and caramel, as well as some alcohol warmth. Pretty good Barleywine, but not my fave.
bottleshare thanks to Beechner224. Nose is chewy raisins and malt. Pour is murky brown. Taste is malty sweet with an alcohol warming. A little oxidized.
2007 bottle from mcbahkus. Pours a cloudy murky brown. Aroma is malty boost. Taste is sweet, malty, raisin, alright for being so damn old.
355ml bottle (2014 vintage) from Good Spirits Company, Glasgow - clear brown, non-existent head, treacle toffee aroma, viscous, treacle toffee flavour, low carbonation
Bottle courtesy of Mr_H a reddish brown ale with candied sugar aroma taste is dark fruits brown sugar and sweet malt carmel and toffee on the finish
12oz bottle shared with mr_h. Reddish brown, reasonable head. Barley malt aroma. Barley sugar flavour. Strong sweet alcohol aftertaste. Not my thing.

Bottle from Total Wine. Pours hazy copper color with tan head that disappears quickly. Aroma is bready and malty. Taste is strong in malts and caramel with some fruit and a lot if alcohol tossed in for good measure. Slightly carbonated with a sticky mouthfeel. Terrific beer.

Bottle to snifter. 2014 bottle. Aged three years. Pour is copper with a tiny head. Aroma is malty and caramel sweet, a bit bready. Taste follows through but adds an alcohol burn. Finish is smooth. Good shit. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle, 2013 vintage. Clear copper colour, small head. Bready aroma, with some fruit notes. Flavour is rich and complex, with cherry, bread, raisin and wood notes. Quite a nice barley wine.
Bottle - Vintage 2005 - Caramel and cherry with a bit of booze. Clear copper with a thin head. Caramel with a boozy finish. Little hot and alcoholic.
Taste is too sweet, with some wood and dark fruits plus booze in the flavor. Body is medium to full with slight carbonation and a sticky mouthfeel. but its still definitely a sipper and a strong one

12 oz. bottle, 2013 vintage. Appearance: half finger of tan head that does not last, oily to no lacing, cloudy amber-brown color. Aroma: oak, nutty, caramel, light vanilla, light prune. Palate: medium body, average to slightly lively carbonation, alcohol warming, oily texture, very malty finish. Taste: nice fruit and malt sweetness combination, with the malts taking over at the end and alcohol showing up then too. Overall, very nice beer, super smooth, good balance, and just well done.

Pours a hazy brown like apple cider with a slight white head. Has a deliciously sweet aroma of dark fruits and caramel. Flavor is dark fruit and brown sugar. This barley wine has tons of flavor, as most do, but it doesnt have the same harsh bite that many others have. Delicious, full of aroma and flavor until the last drop.

2013 bottle. recommended by clerk. A little pricey. chilled lightly and wow ! so full of flavour. worth the price. alcohol is well hidden. lots of dried fruit. my first barley wine. will keep a few in cellar to age. North Coast rocks !

2013 - Fruity on the nose with a taste that is malty, faintly buttery, burn sugar, and a nice hop bitterness. The finish is smooth and full. I love this brew and I bet it gets even more buttery over time like butterscotch candy. yum..

Poured a mahagony color out of bottle. Quick fading head. Aroma is malt, hay, and alcohol. Taste follows nose. Going to lay down my second bottle see if it mellows a bit. Decent ale not worth the price.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2015 Aroma is malty grapey. Smooth. 
Looks fine. Sooty brown. Light head. 
Taste is very grape like. Smooth. Oaky. Sweet. 
Oh this is the 2014 version. 
Palate is fine. Smooth. Boozy
Drinks like a scotch ale. Very grape like. Tastes like a better more full bodied founders dirty bastard. Solid beer. Have one in the cellar since the box told me to do so. 

2014 version in 2015!!! Boozy. Very grape. Belgian like. Holy god boozy. This is damn like drinking a whiskey. Dry, boozy, oaky. Worse with age (well I think.... it wasnt that great to begin with). So done with aging beer.

2012 bottle poured into a snifter. Medium off-white head that dissipates quickly. Malty aroma with hint of earth and hay and raisin. Wish the aroma was a bit stronger. Light orange-brown color. Hazy. Tastes like a barleywine - very malty with a slight bitter hop finish; sweet. Pretty smooth for 11.7 abv. Im glad that I tried this beer, but its far from my favorite.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2015 2011 drank in 2014. Nice sherry, fig, sweet sun dried raisins, light booze, complex, and just a nice sipping beer. Great barley wine that ages really well. 
2010 bottle drank in 2015. Raisen, dried apricot, a little pear across the palate. Nice sweet taste with a clean finish. Great beer!

UPDATED: APR 27, 2014 2009 bootle from the rotebox. big potent sherry notes, figs, port-like character. soft boozy rumcake notes. sherry oxidation. perhaps a touch thinned out with time. nose pretty chill. better than expected. pretty drinkable.
Bottle: Poured a mahogany brown with a thin beige head. Aroma is sticky malts, figs, dark fruit, sweet warm feeling. Taste is strong dark fruit, sweet malts, and nice light alcohol burn.
Drank from a bottle at a bar. Really strong beer. The taste is a bit sweet. Not as good as I expected.

33cl bottle, vintage 2012. Mahogany color, thin white head. Toffee, malt, wood and sweetness in aroma. Toffee lingering, some alcohol stickyness, malt and some dried fruits. Long sweet finish. Slightly unbalanced and alcohol coming through too much to be enjoyable.

Bottle, vintage 2012. Pours amber in color with an off-white head. Sweet brown sugar and dark 

syrup in aroma. Also some dark fruits and vinous notes are present. Quite pleasant aroma 

indeed. Dark syrup, malty sweetness and vinous notes in taste. Scaringly easy to drink despite 

the quite high abv.

Pours a deep amber color with a caramel aroma. Taste is clean but finishes with a burn. Nice high alcohol flavor with a mellow malt flavor. The burn fades quickly, and leaves the chest with a warm tingle. A good beer for the style.

Had a 2011 vintage. Decent Barleywine. Pours brown with a just a tinge of red. Slight white head. Scent is hay, grass, and molasses. Despite age, hop characted still existed. Interested to see if this tastes more like a IIPA when fresh. Nice beer. Might like to do a vertical someday. Bottle - Received in Trade

Aroma - not much there. 

Appearance - amber no head on aggressive pour. 

Taste - smooth for such high ABV. Not much there for me. Drinks like a session. 

Mouth - med carb 

Overall - nothing like old stock reserve. Just okay.

2014 bottle poured into a snifter. Aroma was somewhat boozy. Appearance was a clear red amber with a very small light tan head that rapidly vanished. Taste was fairly boozy with dark fruits, prunes, raisins, plums. Palate was excellent. This beer is definitely a sipper and can use some age. I have multiple years of this beer and they can be aged a number of years with great results. I highly recommend setting some aside.
Bottle. Hazy and amber in color. Medium thin off-white head. Nice sweetness and warming alcohol.

Poured from a bottle into a snifter a red amber color with minimal head.
Aroma is very boozy dark fruit a lot of sweetness. Caramel. Malts.
Flavor is high ABV syrupy with some clove & toffee. So delicious.
Higher carbonation but know from bottles consumed of earlier years hat this will even 
Overall a rock solid Old Ale. Grateful for the ones I have tasted and even more so to lay a few of them down.

Partial vertical for Chubby Liver. 2013, 2012, and 2007. Will rerate this some day when I have one bottle all to myself, but: amber pour. Aroma is huge on raisins when fresh, with the raisins chilling and mellowing more as the age comes in. Toffee, caramel, and raisins/plums, but the raisin really is prominent here. Surprisingly, as I dont care for real raisins, this was one of my favorites on the night. Full body, mellow and delicious at any age. Love a beer that is just as great aged as it is fresh.

2013 vintage. Pours a amber color with little to no head. Aromas of toffee, dark fruit, port wine. Taste consists of pure maple sugar syrup with a small bitterness. Very sweet. Flavors of caramel, maple fudge, dough, figs, Bleh. This is completely terrible. No.

Pours a rich red amber color with a thin white head. Malt, caramel, dark fruit, molasses and some alcohol aroma. Malt, caramel, cherry, plum, raisin, molasses, hop, alcohol and vanilla flavors. Medium full body with mild carbonation. Sweet taste with a warm caramel, dark fruit and alcohol finish. 2014

Bottle. Hazy amber color with a medium thin off-white head. Aroma of cherry, vanilla, oak and berries. Sour and bitter taste with some sweetness. Medium body. Bitter and sweet finish with some warming alcohol.-- via beerbasher/winphone

Draft (2014) at ChurchKey poured into a tasting snifter. Pours a ruby/amber color with a finger of off-white head. Aromas of caramel, dark fruit, vanilla, dark chocolate. Tasting notes of dark fruit, dark chocolate, sweet malt, light hops, caramel, light vanilla. Medium body with a dry and slightly warm finish. Low carbonation. Fairly smooth for the ABV.
12oz bottle. Its got a good warming feel. Flavors of dark fruit and chocolate malt. Everything this brewery puts out is good.

2014 edition. Heavy malt aroma, touches of dried fruit, wood and peat. Alcohol even burns the nose slightly. Dark brown/ruby with thin but tight beige head. Taste is more malt, oak barrel, plums. silky mouthfeel and lots of alcohol warmth. Smooth finish.
A clear reddish brown beer with a small off-white head. The aroma is caramel with a nice dose of tropical fruit. The flavor is fruity and bready with the alcohol being pretty noticeable.
2011 bottle. Pours a deep murky reddish brown with diminishing beige head and no lace. Aroma vanilla,toffee, brandy, figs. Medium body, slightly watery. Crazy smooth for the abv.
Crazy plum and tart flavor. Fruity. Dark amber color with white head that quickly dissapates. Very jammy and thick. Tons going on with the flavor. Not bad for a barleywine. Draft at Jerry's

2011 vintage - Sort of a rusty cloudy brown, no foam. Caramel, dark fruits and some orange peel in the aroma. Taste is big caramel, dark fruits, coffee and a little citrus. The heavy mouthfeel helps the flavors linger. After a few years most of the alcohol taste has mellowed. Excellent beer.

Murky brown pour with quickly fading tan head. Aroma of raisins sweet malts, fig. Flavor is more of the aroma, dates, brown sugar, alcohol, caramel, toffee. This is unlike what I expected and awesome.

2010 vintage.

12oz bottle int a pint glass.

Pours a hazy dark brown with just a tiny wispy head. Not really any lacing but there is a thin ring around the edge of the glass.

Aroma is quite sweet with caramel, toffee, and figs. There is a slight sherry/oxidized note about it as well.

Taste is extremely sweet right off the bat. Caramel is huge and just seems to overwhelm any other flavors that might be present. I can also tell this one has oxidized over time. Sherry flavors are present and there is a bit of a port like quality. Sweet throughout with a very sticky, almost cloying, finish.

Overall, I was really hoping this would be an awesome experience with this beer having so much age but it is just too sweet. A bit one dimensional as well. I may need to seek out a fresh example sometime.

2013 bottling.
Appearance: The body is a mildly murky amber to garnet with a dense light tan head. The head quickly forms a dense coating.
Aroma: The aroma leans a little fruity with hints of oak, odd since it snot oak aged. Earthy tones poke through the fruitiness along with a dash of caramel. The aroma smells okay, but isnt very aromatic.
Taste: The flavor is big and malty with subtle fruity esters. Big brown sugar and molasses along with caramel make a big malt base with a slight spiciness overlying with fig. Big and easy to drink, this only hints at alcohol on the finish.
Palate: Full-bodied, near thick, with light carbonation.
Overall: Despite my rating, I have a lot of respect for this beer. Its one of the few beers Id ever want to age a bunch of while still tasting good fresh. This could certainly use a few months in the cellar, but it drinks nicely now.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2014 Bottle, 2013 vintage, cellared about 1 year. Rich dark fruit aroma with a little bit of booze. Pours copper colored with a thin light brown head and some lacing. Sweet dark fruit flavors as well as some caramel malt to start. Finishes smooth with just a bit of booziness. Very good, probably even better if aged longer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2013 bottle from Save On. Garnet red/amber with ring and full of micro floaties. I didnt expect to have to decant it. Vinous woody hop and caramel aroma. Toasted caramel ripe cherry brandy sweetness just short of syrupy with woody hop bitterness bordering on astringency. Medium full body. Not my favorite barleywine or North Coast beer. Just not my style I guess.

Backlog from the 2011 vintage. Bottle bought at Systembolaget. I have a hard time with barley wines in general this one was decent though. High in sweetness and alcohol, lots of raisins and dried fruits, probably should have aged it for a couple of years.

2013 bottle from Tipples. Pours dark amber red colored with a one finger yellowish tannish head. Aroma of sweet dark fruits, leather, caramel, some aroma that gives this a lager like smell. Flavor follows with sweet fruits, plums, a bit of caramel, and a sweet finish that reminds me of a bock. This is interesting and doesnt scream barleywine or old ale to me. Medium heavy mouthfeel with medium low carbonation. Some alcohol warmth going down that makes this a nice winter warmer. Not what I expected after trying the Cellar Reserve version.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2015 Flaska från SB. Rubinröd vötska med gulvitt skum. Intensiva dofter av dadlar, russin och citrus. Komplex och djup. Hög sötma i smaken och kraftig beska. Rejält eldig munkänsla. 11,2% alkohol lämnar sina avtryck. Lång eftersmak.
Re-rate med flera årgäångar provade:
2014, dadlar, russin och lite mandel i doften. Söta druvor, typ sauterne balanserad av en stor beska.

2013. fikon, bränd karamell och russin i doften. Smakerna gifter sig bättre än 2014. Honungssötma framträder.

2012, fikon, fänkol och bittermandel i doften. Smak av honung och karamell. Ingen beska. Vinös.

2011, russin, druvor, madeira i doften. Mjuk munkänsla. Smak av lite apelsin. Ingen beska.

2010, lite stalliga toner. Fikon, russin. Väldigt mjuk munkänsla. Toksöt. Funkar bra till en kraftig grönmögelost!

2013 bottle. Pours a murky brown with little head. Very carbonated at first and taste if raisins, dark fruit and hoppy bitterness to finish. Needs some time but after tasting prior aged vintages it will stand up.

Beautiful Reddish brown color with a little head. Nice cherry arroma. Tastes very very sweet. Like decadent sweet fruits or a fine wine. Maybe just a little too sweet for my taste. Deap alcohol burn on the finish. This beer makes a great lead in as it prepares your Palate for your favorite Belgian Quad.

pours clear bright copper-orange with a very nice creamy off-white head, good retention and lacing. smooth caramel, dried apricots and other dusty dried red little fruits, warming alcohol, very fruity - oranges, bitter aromatic herbs, fairly woody, southern comfort feeling if not brandy-like warming flavors, maple, cocoa powder. moderate carbonation, medium body - oily and a bit sticky, boozy, grassy-spicy-lightly piney finish. complex, tasty and very good! solid!

2007; APPEARANCE: Murky brown with reddish accents, no head to speak of (may have been too cold); TASTE: sweet, roundish; NOSE: dark sugars, and fruits; PALATE: very slight carbonation, big body and slightly sticky or creamy; OVERALL: Too sweet, it is like an aperitif.

Pours a super hazy dark burnt orange with a small off white head. Lots of raisins and caramel malt on the nose, vanilla, dark cherry, and maybe a touch of milky chocolate. Lots of cherry on the taste, a little fig and plum, and then lots of caramel/vanilla flavors, and maybe some brown sugar. Not overly sweet, enough maltier notes to cut through the fruity notes at the front of the tongue. Very smooth.
Smells of dried fruit. Taste is oak, honey, a hint of smoke, a faint whiff of booze. Subtle hops at the end.

Bottle from Lazy Dog. Pours slightly hazy amber with a thin layer of off white head. Aroma of dark fruit, sweet, and an undercurrent of booze. Taste of vanilla and cherries with a slightly oaky/boozy that lingers.

2013 draft at Beermuda. Pours a clearish golden color with no head. Aroma of vanilla and raisins. Taste is sweet and a but hot from alcohol. Really great sipper and Im surprised I havent had it sooner.

2013 bottle. Pours hazy amber with an off white head that lasts. Smells of honey and oak. Drinks smoothly with mild lingering hop bitterness. Medium to full bodied. Tastes of honey, dried fruit, and rye. Buries 12 percent alcohol.

Shared 750 ml. bottle(2011) poured to snifters showing a darkest brown color with some ruby highlighting, a light layer of off white head foam, and minimal lacing, maybe light spots at best. The nose presented an initial hint of soy, then continued with dark fruit, and brown sugar, nearly treacle-like sweetness. Medium+ bodied, with soft carbonation, the taste was quite sweet & malty, but tempered and improved by the warming, cognac-like alcohol. Surprised at the soy for only a couple of years age, but wasnt apprized of the cellaring care.

2009 vintage. On tap into tulip. St. Paul. 


Appearance: copper/orange color. Mostly transparent, but some haze. Small rim of white head. 

Aroma: caramel, raisin, malty, dark fruit, alcohol.

Taste: sweet up front. Mild bitterness in the finish. Warming Alcohol. 

Palate: thick, syrupy. Mostly still carbonation. Long finish

Overall: very nice beer. On the sweeter side. Nice warming alcohol. Pretty complex.
God duft av malt, druer og krydder. Dyp mørk rødbrun farge. Lite skum. Godssmak av frukter.  2009 versjonen.
Bottle->snifter. Cloudy dark amber with small tan head. Caramel malt, dark fruit, bread, some spice. Bittersweet, boozy. Could use some aging, but quite good.

2013 bottle. Pours a dark amber with a small off white head. Aromas of fruit and vanilla are faint but nice. This is warming as it goes down and has a nice amount of carbonation. The taste of booze, vanilla, malts, and some hops all add up very well to make this a great beer.

12 oz. bottle. 2012 edition. Pours a cloudy, deep amber, with an off-white, tight head that dissipates moderately. Aromas of milk-chocolate, caramel, fruit (maybe fig?), and vanilla. Taste is sweet with flavors of caramel, vanilla, and just a hint of black-cherry. Full-bodied with a thick, creamy texture. Carbonation is average. Finish is smooth and sweet. Overall, I really like this beer. Although, as it warms up it gets sweeter. By the time it reaches room temperature it is almost cloyingly sweet. However, straight out of the fridge is a little too cold and you dont get all the subtleties. So i suggest letting it warm up for 5 minutes before indulging.

Bottled 2012 edition. Pours a dark cloudy brown with beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, chocolate, dried fruits, vanilla with some woody notes. Taste is medium sweet leading to a hefty sweet fruity finish with some slight alcohol burn on the way down. Awesome stuff.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2015 Tasty, but may be a bit too boozy for its own good. Pours a cloudy red. Smells like malt liquor and a bit of figs. Taste is vanilla, malts and booze. Had in the bottle and on tap at the brewery.

From a 75 cl bottle shared at home. Pours a clear amber with an thick ecru head. Caramel nose. Flavors of plum, caramel and raisins. Medium heavy bodied, light carbonation,, smooth slightly boozy finIsh.
Bottle at Vitos. This made me rethink my stance on barley wines. Very complex. Opened up nicely after warming in the glass. I hope the 2013 is as good.

Vintage 2012, reviewed 07MAR12
ABV 11.7%
Pours a ruby ale with a nice dome of cream foam. Smells of alcohol, grain, some caramel, nothing special. Flavor is alcoholic, bitter, some sweetness, some bitterness. Really poorly defined. I dont recall having had this so fresh, but I dont recommend. Medium on viscous body with moderate carb and a semi dry finish. Im not impressed fresh. Maybe one should simply buy and age as the beer is better with just a year on it. 

Note to NC: release beer when ready, no sooner. 

Vintage 2010, Reviewed 22MAR11
A: Pours a beautiful mahogany ale with hues of cherry red. Single finger head of roasted peanut dissipates in a couple minutes and leaves a thin sheet of the same. Spotty lacing. Brilliant clarity.
S: Initially, alcohol comes out punching! Then I get the tones of vanilla, malt, cherries (maraschino), light soapy smell (not bad, but different). Good nose, will be better with age I bet.
T: Mmmm. Toffee, light noble hops, cascade resin and citrus are subdued, yet present. Alcohol is slightly sweet, but not in any way offensive. Hint of cornbread. Again, maraschino cherries. Nice. The toffee keeps teasing me, more time = more toffee = more happy!
M: Full bodied and medium carbonation. Dries the mouth and forces my tongue to push for resonating flavors. Nice.
O: Excellent crafsmanship. Good old ale. The profile compels me to keep a dozen in the cellar for a year or two. Should become more tawny in character. Pretty stoked about the potential here. 4/4/4/4/4-4

Serving type: bottle

03-08-2012

Bottle, 2012 vintage. Pours an auburn brown with a small, yellowish-brown head. Aroma is caramel, a bit boozy. Toffee, light breadiness. Taste is a lot of caramel as well. Some syrupiness, dried dark fruit. A bit boozy as it warms up. Full and carbonated. Not too complex, but a nice sipper.

Bottle from Akkurat. Thanks to a bloke in the pub. It pours a brown colour with a small off white head. Aroma is bready, caramel, dark fruit, alcohol, touch of spice and vanilla. Taste is similar with caramel up front, alcohol and dark fruit, then finishes with some bitterness and dry. Relatively smooth and medium bodied. Very good indeed.

2010 and 2011 12oz bottles side by side.
Aroma on both have a similar malt character with toasted bread, caramel, and toffee. Some fig and raisin notes. The 2010 has almost not hop character and shows a bit of oxidation with some honey and wet paper. The 2011 is definitely brighter with some citrus and resin hop notes and doesnt seem to have much oxidation. 2011 wins on aroma.
They both pour a slightly murky copper amber with a tan head. The 2011 had more head and it was thicker. Both receded quickly to the edges. Light lacing and faint legs. 2011 wins on appearance.
The flavor is a bit different between the two. The 2010 has a much smoother flavor with well integrated malt and fruit components. Lots of toasted bread, caramel and toffee with raisin and fig notes. Light prune notes as well but not much hop character. Medium bitterness and light alcohol note in the finish. The 2011 flavor is a bit rougher on the edges but is also brighter and fresher. Caramel, toasted bread and toffee again dominate. Lesser, but similar in character, fruit notes than the 2010. More hop bitterness and a bit of hop flavor still intact. More alcohol spice in the finish. 2010 wins for flavor.
2011 is medium full bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 2010 is similar but with medium low to low carbonation. I think I like the lower carbonation as it had less carbonic bite. 2010 wins on mouthfeel.
Overall they are fairly similar but the difference of a year is noticeable. The year really hurt the aroma of the 2010, but I think it did a lot to smooth out the flavor. I actually dont like the contribution of the hops to the flavor, but found it helped with the aroma.
2013 bottle at Brewforia Eagle. Pleasant malty sweetness, smooth for 11.9% but slightly medicinal. Mouthfeel is light and tingly, doesn?t seem right for this style.
2013 vintage pours copper, aromas of cherries and vanilla. Full mouth feel, sweet in the tongue, alcohol is makes nicely for almost 12%, pretty good beer

2011 - Deep dark red/copper pour. Aroma was a little disappointing with not much there. Head was very thin and quickly dissipated. Thick mouthfeel with a nice high alcohol pull that brings the belgian candy tastes to the front.

2013 vintage. Poured from the bottle a dark red. Big off-white head with very fine texture that hangs around for a long time. Lots of lacing on the glass. Fruity aroma, and caramel. Sweet, not hoppy. Creamy mouthfeel. This should age nicely.
Årgång 2013. Väldigt fruktig, första tanken går åt en extrem fyllig cider. Nog känns den höga alc.nivån, men stör inte heller. På det hela taget en upplevelse, men den kräver sitt tillfälle.

Flaska från SB, årgång 2013. Rödorange, lätt dimmig, med smutsvitt litet skum som snart lägger sig. Doft av russin, karamell, citrus, plommon, körsbär och grapemarmelad Den höga alkoholen ger en närmast glöggliknande känsla i munnen, med värmen och julkänslan. Där hittas apelsin, karamell, russin, ingefära, söt lakrits, fruktkaka och plommon. Alkoholen klistrar sig fast i gommen. Mycket gott.

2013 bottle.
Aroma: Dried fruits, apple, freshly crushed malt, bread.
Taste: A hint of hop bitterness, caramel, malt sweetness, dried fruit (raisins).

FROM NOTES: August 12, 12. 2002 version tasted.
Poured from a cellared 12 ounce bottle into a Spiegelau tulip, with MUCH anticipation! 

A: HUGE wine smell, I get plum notes, some toffee notes and a slight alcohol burn.
A: Pours a cloudy, almost opaque walnut-hue with very little head and no lacing. Murky is the word here. 
T: WOW! Incredible, other-worldly complex beer. Intense flavors cascading on the palate like a Greek dinner in a family restaurant on Crete. Strong merlot flavors keep surfacing, but the overall smoothness dominates. 
P: Medium body with extremely mild carbonation.. Silky, mildly astringent. The finish is moderately dry. 
O: Without a doubt, the SMOOTHEST barley wine Ive ever had! I was scared to drink a 10 year old beer, and the pour was so murky it only heightened the anxiety. The first taste quelled all fears and I was instantly struck by how smooth and refined the taste was, despite its overwhelming complexity. The high ABV creates a waming that improves the overall taste and reminds that the beer is to be taken VERY seriously. WOW! Im a lucky dude.....

Dark orange, almost crimson pour with a rocky two and a half finger beige head that dissipates rather quickly. Theres more carbonation that I was expecting, looks great in the glass. The aroma is a sweet malty bomb, big dark fruit esters, brown sugar, dark bread, sweet chocolate and of course alcohol booziness. On the tongue, I get big dark fruit flavors like fig, date, berries, cherry, caramel, slight citrus and chocolate in the back. I definitely taste and feel the alcohol, but its not in an unwelcome way. Good complexity and something quite different from a lot thats out there. North Coast are pioneers and one of the more under appreciated breweries out there.

12 oz 2013 bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits. Pours a mostly clear copper colour with a few floaties and modest-sized, slightly off-white head. Aroma is sweet and lightly boozy with lots of fruitiness and caramel as well as a little earthy leather character. Flavour is candied sugar, raisins, figs, toffee, leather and a little earthiness. Some alcohol definitely apparent. Mellow carbonation and smooth in the mouth. Nice.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours thick orange with a nice offwhite head. Upfront aroma of dried apricots, raisins, a touch of leathery yeast, and some caramel malts. Almost like a cross between a barley wine and strong ale. Flavours are malt driven - loads of caramel, toffee, dried apricots and raisins. Warm booziness down the back adds to the sweetness. Awesome drop.
full body, light sweetness, nice amber color, noticeable alcohol. Quite tasty overall.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2014 Bottle: 2012. Extremely dense, turbid copper with even a mild red-ish hue to it; beige head lasts for a few moments before reducing to a soapy collar. Aroma is dominated with some boozy figs & prunes, a touch of anise, & a sweet, glazed toffee underbody. Faint vanilla. Definitely smells hefty, but the booze isnt too brash. Quite a bit of licorice up front, both sweet red & deep black, hefty raisin & date notes, lathered in sweet caramel sauce & smooth whiskey. The booze aspect is strong & robust without turning into solvent or pure heat. Sticky sweet caramel & toffee malt in the finish with a lighter, grape-y fruit. Very nice ale; this one was aged a little over a year.

Bottle from Alko. Dark red / rusty color, white head. Bittersweet taste with citrus, hops, caramel, toffee, syrup, raisins, oak and a bit of alcohol. Very smooth body and the high ABV is very well hidden. Bitter finish with hops, toffee and raisins. Excellent barley wine with very pleasant balance of hops and malts.

12 oz. bottle, 2013. Pour is a murky orange rust color with a thin khaki head. Alcohol legs and not a lot of lacing. Aroma is cherries and dates with a raisin and citrus note as well. Some caramel, faint hops and an identifiable earthy kind of funk as well. Taste is very malty, sweet dark fruits, cherry, caramel, vanilla, wood. Flavors are soft and the booze is very present in the finish, not overly sweet. Faint hops linger a bit on the tongue. Mouthfeel very chewy with smooth, creamy carbonation. A very big beer, enjoyable, am interested to see how it mellows over time. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap 5 oz. sample at Judges' Bench in Ellicott City, MD. 

Lightly hazy, medium amber with a small off-white head and fair lacing. 

Aroma of caramel, ripe fruit and molasses. 

Taste of caramel, alcohol, raisins, plums and malts. 

Full/medium body and medium/low carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: NOV 3, 2013 Bottle. Strong ale with a lot of flavor. Quite boozy, kind of like an English version of a quadruple. Too sweet though and not too balanced.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2013 2012 bottle. Very smooth. Light vanilla aroma, not much aroma though. Not much of a head either. Actually not that thick on the tongue (lots of carbonation on the tongue) and does not seem like the abv. very mild light vanilla and barley flavors. very mild in flavor. Kinda boring. 

2013 bottle.  Sweeter a bit more mouth feel.  Overal same rather lack luster beer.

Bottle from Total Wine in Boca Raton, FL. Poured into tulip at home. Hazy brown-amber with a one finger, fast disappearing white head. No lacing. The aroma is dark fruits such as prunes, raisins and overripe grapes. Also a sweet aroma overall. The taste is complex with dark fruits (same as listed in the aroma) and a heavy malt presence. You get the aging on the backend. For an 11.9% it hides the booze well. Very smooth mouth, medium to full in body. Light carbonation. Finish is booze and fruit. It is a little sweet but overall a very very nice BW.
Bottle from notes. Roasty toffee with dark fermented fruits, rasins and a little citrus. Boozy, but much less than I was expecting. Im digging it.
Bottle. Smells doughy, vanilla. Tastes dark fruits- raisins, fruity, vanilla. Really smooth, tasty, worth a try!

2013 bottle poured amber red in glass with light off-white head. Aroma is estery with slight fruity/banana/citrus notes. Taste is a bit sharp initially due to the carbonation and finishes quite malt-forward. A bit ethanol at the end. Not a whole lot of hop characteristic here, A slight bitterness in the finish. Overall, this is a really nice old ale...especially for the price point. Im really interested to see how this ages out over the years.
Good stuff. Pours a dark amber. Very attractive. Aromas of bread and yeast, dark fruits and sherry. Very malty and some warm booze. Dark raisin bread flavors. Toast too. Yum.
0,33l bottle of 2012 from the flagship Alko. Pours clear chestnut with a low head. Aroma is sweet malts, fruits and alcohol. Flavor is sweet malts, dark fruits, alcohol and plenty of hops. Very nice.

Duff oversweet steel wool. 
Odd pinky copper Peppery burn on the finish, sweet caramel linger. Firm uncompromising booziness on the finish. Sloshing. Bottle, Going Dutch Tasting

bottle at home ... Huge thanks to who ever gave it to me ... 2004 Vintage Drunk 2013 ... deep copper brown ... thin tan lacing ... soft sweet toffee roast ... soft oxidasion ... light umami ... soft sweet roast ... soft toffee ... dry fruits ... sweet toffee ... soft malts ... soft but long umami linger
2013 bottle poured. Very dark and murky color. Tasted a little syrupy with some sort of fruit undertone.

2011 bottle. Dark copper/brown pour with an off-white head. Aromas of caramel, toffee, brandy, and candied fruit. Flavor follows suit with some nice warming in the finish from the abv. Very nice brew and very drinkable.
Sweet fruit taste. Fruity fragrance too. The aftertaste is a typical Belgian beer. Not for me unfortunately. Vintage 2013. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Bottle. Brown with ruby. Thick toffee and candi. A bit syrupy and a bit of alcohol heat.

Klar orange-brun-röd med ett orange skum som snabbt försvinner. Doft: Rom russin, ek, melon likör, papaya, tropisk blomm honung, alkohol. Smak: Tropisk blomm honung, honungs melon, blommigt, dadlar, sockervadd, trä, alkohol, granatäpple.

Bottle, similar to the one pictured, 2006 vintage. Amazing how this bottle cap is still locked on tight even though its been in my non-temp-controlled cellar for a few years now. Dead still. Deep hazy mahogany brown. Smells strongly of boozy caramel, almost a bourbon smell to it. Extremely creamy mouthfeel and a bit of a buttery flavor - but in a good way. Caramel, toffee, maybe even cognac rather than bourbon. Very good, even 7 years later.
12 oz bottle, 2013. Pours a clear with minimal lacing. Malty and alcohol nose. Very very smooth malt nose with some honey in the taste. One of the best non BA Barleys. Finishes smooth with some burn.

Draft to taster (2012 vintage). Looks good for the style; a cloudy amber with lacing somewhere between the color of off-white and light beige. Smells solid; sweet and malty with notes of caramel. Tastes like it smells with a nice, smooth mouthfeel. Enjoyable.

2010 Vintage stored in cellar. Very dark. Aroma is light yeast and malt taste. Flavour is beautiful - richness like a dark belgian ale, booze, dark pudding. Palate is nice lingering malt and clannish finish. Overall, a malt goody with a lovely sweet finish.

5 sept 2013, bottle. 2012 otsuchi edition. Copper, clear, some bubbles. Nose is raisins and mild bready malt. Full body and moderately fizzy. Big alcohol, raisins, blue fruit, bready yeast. Pretty good!

@ Havregatan. Flaska (2013) från Systembolaget (44:-). I doften finns sötma, smör, vanilj, äpple. I smaken hittar jag sötma, vanilj, toffee, russin. Fyllig med en lång eftersmak. Jag gillar ju egentligen inte Barley Wines, men den här är faktiskt helt ok. Undrar då hur bra den kommer att vara om ett par år?
Big sweet dark fruit nose. Beer is really sweet to me. 2012 vintage. Maybe it will mellow but it like sweet syrupy raisins. Guess I may not be man enough for this one

Beer pours a murky brown caramel color with a slightly off white one finger head. The nose starts off with a big raisin note, very malty. There are notes of fig and prunes and maybe some plum. Sweet caramel and slight toffee notes fight through the dark fruit notes. Maybe a hint of alcohol, but it comes off as more of a sweetness, this is over a year old. The taste starts off sweet, slight candied fruit. Then, bitterness in the middle of the palate that quickly moves into the raisin/dark fruit component. Finishes with a big malty sweetness. The beer is mildly carbonated. A nice creamy ring of head hangs around. Big alcohol legs up and down the glass, but the beer is 11.7% so yea. Medium full mouthfeel/body on the beer. As it warms, the booze becomes a bit more present. Some toffee notes also start to come out on the nose and in the middle/finish of the palate. I like this one a lot. Could be just a hair sweeter.

2012 version poured into a snifter. Looks like a thick, gooey liquid in my glass. Giant aroma of sugar, candy, molasses & alcohol. Flavor matches the aroma. Sweet & syrupy. Subtle flavor of alcohol (almost scotchy) is present throughout. Leaves a bit of a tingle on the tongue.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2013 
2013 vintage followed by 2011 vintage cellared at 55-65º, each bottled at 11.9% abv

-

The 2013 vintage is complex and layered, offering a multitude of eloquent characteristics

A clear, vibrant, dark cherry body displays fiery vermillion and amber highlights with a two inch off white-light khaki head dissipating to a very thin, yet complete ring and a few medium to small, translucent, delicate islands

Spiced dark cherry, licorice, plumb, prune, orange, and fig esters mingle with mellow milk chocolate, coffee cake, cream, and dark wood on a medium, well carbonated body which rolls into a silky, frothy cream texture; flavors resonating and concentrating to a lightly alcoholic, cherry and horehound finish with medicinal flairs expressing a building, soft warmth as the quaff exits the harbor

12oz bottle 2013 vintage at 60º into 16oz Spiegelau Soiree Brandy

-

2011 is further refined and integrated demonstrating flowing, restrained confidence

Color has grown a step deeper offering a smaller, more delicate and loosely structured head which completely dissipates

Characteristics of the 2013 vintage have married and condensed into bourbon soaked fruit cake bringing candied, toasted barrel and moist leather to mind; carbonation has dissipated, allowing the palate to mature into a silky smooth texture with medium heft; alcohol notes have become a proponent of the ales rich dynamics, further accompanying and accentuating the spectrum of rich, aristocratic aromas and flavors

12oz bottle 2011 vintage at 60º into 16oz Spiegelau Soiree Brandy

2013 bottle. Pours a dark murky brown with not much head, but the carbonation was medium to high with small bubbles. Aroma is brown sugar hops and caramel. Taste is Brown sugar and hops medley with a little caramel and heat. Medium body. Id like this better with less carbonation and a little bigger malt profile, but good old ale that is buy more of.

Pours a dirty copper amber color with a smooth tan head. A bit fruity on the nose with hints of vomit. Over carbonated in my opinion. Sticky on the lips. Figgy flavor that gets stale to quickly. Noticeable alcohol warmth and bitterness at the finish. I remember this to be better. But, its been some years since the.

Bottle (2013) from systembolaget. Nice caramel and syrup aroma, although with some alcohol notes. The taste is really malty with lots of syrup and caramell. The beer is thick but has a bit to much carbonation for my taste. The finish is long and contains some refreshing bittnerness. The beer also comes with some nice alcoholic warmth.
Conclusion: A nice Barley wine which I cant wait (although I have to) to taste aged for 5-10 years

(Bottle, 2913 vintage). Nice scent of sweet figs and brown sugar. Sweet taste of brown sugar, figs, raisins, malt and alcohol, which, however, are surprisingly well hidden in the taste. It is not noticeable that the beer is at 11.9%. The aftertaste has hints of vanilla and bourbon.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2014 Fresh from the store. Boozy, well blended malt backbone with lots of fruit and brandy/port in the flavor. Long finish. Very good, smooth.

One year on: Bold dark fruits and cherry, but no raison or prune. Malt almost exclusively like very dark bread crusts. Still smooth. Not boozy.

2012 Bomber. Pours a rich copper with a heavy almond white head and some nice lacing. This is one big beer. Flavors are raisin, alcohol, malt with good carbonation. I love this beer. This is definitely one to buy 2 or 3 - drink one and cellar the rest. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Rich, copper colour and a rich, copper (in a good way!) taste. Smooth, relaxing and full bodied.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2017 2013 poured to snifter. Very interesting . . . not your typical strong ale. High ABV was a bit too much in the taste when I first had this, but I suspected it would mellow out with some aging. Four years later I was rewarded with a smother version of this good old ale.

Bottle 35 cl, 2013 edition, from Systembolaget. Clear deep copper with a slightly beige head. Raisins, sweet caramel, generic dark fruit, red apples, figs, brown sugar, syrup. Quite full body, thick syrupy texture, soft carbonation, long sweet fruity finish. Slight alcohol flavour and some warming. Really nice!

Dark, copper with a 3 finger high head. Lots of lacing. 
Nose: Marsipan, vanilla, syrup, apple, caramel malt & butter. 
Taste: Sweetness, marsipan, eggnodd, vanilla, bourbon whiskey and cake. 
Full, complex body with little carbonation. 
Great! Buy a few and put some away a year or two...

Bottle. Pours golden brown with a full light brown head that lasts. Some lacing. Faint aroma of caramel and bread. Taste is fairly sweet, medium body and a long sticky finish. Pretty boozy and sweet. Drinking this mid-summer, would probably be more appropriate for mid-winter.

Bottle @home. Pours a murky mahogany with a tight white, slowly dissipating head. Aroma is figs, dates, raisins, caramel. ripe apples, muscovado sugar. Taste is dates, raisins, caramel, almonds, ripe apples, honey.

A bit watery in the mouth, not as full-bodied as one could wish for. Nevertheless quite good. Based on having tried verticals of this (2009 - 2011) before, this will age spectacularly. The 2010 version I had last year would easily have been a 4.3. This really needs aging.

2013 vintage on tap. The aroma of this beer is very light overall, but hints of booze as well as caramel and roasted malts do come through, but the appearance is an impressive deep red color with a small off-white head. The taste is a very powerful combination of a mild umami, mild sweetness, and a slight sourness, and the palate mixed a medium body, slick texture, average carbonation, and an astringent finish.
Söt aroma, kanske lite mandelmassa alt. Marsipan. En tjock och len konsistens. Man märker att den har en hög ABV, särskilt i eftersmaken.
Sweet, hints of oak barrel and vanilla. 12% alcohol is surpassing because its so smooth. Great barleywine.
Bottle. 2007. Pours brown no head. Big caramel aroma. Taste is fruit and leather. Some vanilla.
2009 vintage bottle from Blue Maxs stache day. Ages extremely well with the mellowness and the alcohol.

Vintage 2013. Clear cherry/mahogany pour with a tan head that recedes quickly. Brandy and fruit cake dominate the nose with some spicy, earthy notes and a little burnt brown sugar. Warm whiskey on the palate with some stewed fruit and earthy hops in a finish thats a little boozy and medium-sweet.

2013 bottle from Habershams, Savannah. It pours clear mahoganny with a small beige head. The nose is wood, leather, earth, light spice, toast, dried fruit and trifle. The taste is wood, varnish, leather, dried fruit, decent bitterness, spice, toast and toffee with a warming finish. Full body, fine carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Smooth, good depth and balance. A top-notch American barleywine.

2011 vintage drank 2013-June. Pours deep reddish brown with no head or lace. The aroma is intense candied medicinal cherries. Flavor is sweet with woody bitter middle then more of the cherries and some spice thrown in. Feel is stick though fairly light in body with a boozy end. Very good though not super complex at this point. Worth trying again with other vintages.
Kanske är mig det är fel på men jag känner chili i allt nu mera. Härlig sötma men tunn för en barleywine (kanske inte går som det?). Vanilj och kola

Bottle pour..2011 vintage..dark copper red color..aroma of sweet malt.molasses..brown sugar..bourbon..bit of burnt nuttiness as well..medium body..silky smooth mouthfeel..vanilla woody notes come through well and leave a pleasant warming sensation..amazing how the abv is hidden on front yet returns big time.nice complexity behind this..

2013 draft. The aroma very malt forward. Somewhat sweet smelling, as well. The appearance is a murky brown with a lasting head. The taste is very caramel malt that is sweet and then finishes a dry malt flavor. The palate is sweet. Overall, this is a really different kind of barley wine. I am so used to a lot of hops coming through, but this one is just sweet from malt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very dark. Aroma is light yeast and malt taste. Flavour is beautiful - richness like a dark belgian ale, booze,  dark pudding. Palate is nice lingering malt and clannish finish. Overall, a malt goody with a lovely sweet finish.
Thin head. Caramel, malty, and boozy. Best drank only slightly chilled. Nice sipping beer.

Bottle poured into goblet at restaurant.  Dark copper brown color with very thin beige head.  Aroma of heavy bready malt, dark fruit, caramel and booze.  Taste is certainly high ABV, pretty boozy with the thick flavors of the aroma.  Heavy body, low carbonation, rich, syrupy and complex with the lightest bit of bitter finish.  Well executed, Id drink it again.

Cloudy with a light silk head that seemed to "dance" the entire time. Bread like smell to and a very dry fruit taste to it. Overall taste is young but seems promising for perfection if aged

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sample at Hopfest 2013.  Comes reddish brown with a small biege head.  Aroma of fruit, malt, bread, and alcohol.  Taste is dark fruit, malt, bread, alcohol, and a touch of hops.  Nice Barley Wine.

Clear medium ruby amber with a soft ivory head and light swirls of lace.  Taste begins with semi-sweet malt that grows through the palate as more tastes are added - first raisins and fruit cake candied fruit, then a heavy dose of caramel toffee, followed by an alcohol edge to bring things to a balance.  Not for the faint of heart, big, hearty, filling, and impressive.
2012 release. Complex aroma and taste. A lot of caramel and raisins in the flavour. A little sweet. Some warming alcohol in the finish.

12oz bottle 2009 vintage pours a murky brown with a small khaki head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, brown sugar, apples, and figs. Taste has similar favors as aroma with musty alcohol overtones. Booze dominates.

This barley wine has some major kick to it.  Very attractive dark copper color with next to no head.  No lacing what so ever. Has alcohol burn with a general balance of flavor. Great beer if you need or want a very quick buzz.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks avrashi. 2012 vintage. Clear reddish brown with a beige ring. alcohol, honey, sweet and bitter aroma with some chocolate, tastes very sweet but also dry and slightly bitter. Medium-to-full body, syrupy, mildly carbonated with alcoholic finish. Nice.
bottle into glass,  pours clear dark brown, with kacki head,  first drink is prety powerfull,  after you have a few its very enjoyable

Looking forward to this one, heads a bit off, but for 12% I wasn't sure. Really good overall, will enjoy the buzzzzz!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2012 vintage - small foamy head, dark amber color, pretty balanced yet complex aroma and flavor with earthy hops and sweet malt, some alcohol notes come through, very good overall

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks avrashi. 2012 vintage. Pours orange to red clear with a beige head, aroma of honey, apple, caramel and alcohol, flavor of cherries, brandy, light bitterness, medium bodied

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2015 5 år lagrad flaska (2009). Smak och doft av malt, karmell, sirap, brunt socker, smörkola, smör med toner av torkad frukt. Lagom sötma, rund och len, tydlig beska. Riktigt behagligt 4,0p

Smak och doft av humle, malt, toner av torkad frukt, plommon, smörkola. Bra beska som rundar av det hela. 3,5p 15 april 2013

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks avrashi. 2012 vintage. Amber with no head. Aroma of alcohol, malt and some fruitiness. Sweet flavor, malty, caramelly and alcoholic. Medium-bodied, silky mouthfeel.
Rich tasted strong English-style ale. Well-balanced. Not too sweet (as I expected).

Pours ruby-tinged copper with a off-white head.
Nose shows golden syrup, bready melanoidin notes, sultanas and soft booze.
Very rich, malty flavours. Bready melanoidin malt, alcohol, sultanas, brandy. A little harsh.
Slick body, carbonation seems a bit high.

12 ounce bottle of the 2013 (non)vintage. It still tasted great despite its youth and it confirmed my growing preference for barley wines and olde ales. Aroma of plums, undried lacquer and Werthers candy. Appearance is a brilliant red, clear, no foam, minimal lacing. Taste is a mouth-coating scotch, dates and assorted dried fruit, sweet. Palate is sizzling with signals of the high abv, but that aspect is otherwise well hidden. Medium bodied, highly carbonated, very drinkable. Overall its a very good barley wine that sticks to the basics, no gimmicks, which earn it a solid A-. its very well executed, if not incredibly creative.

Bottle. Pours clear ruby with just a trace of thin, fizzy off-white head. Aroma is cherries, figs, cookie and cereal malts, floral hops, and light booze. Flavor is dry, bready malts forward with floral hops, dark fruit, and light vanilla; dry finish. Medium body and low carbonation.
From a bottle. Pours clear cherry red with no head. Very tart and dry, like cider. Funky smell. Light body and high carbonation.
Nice yellow head and chocolate brown colour. There is little chocolate and peanuts in the aroma.
Mild sweetish nose. Pale beige fast disappearing head. Dark copper color. Slightly sweet hoppy and bitter taste with some syrup. Roasty. Warming alcohol. Nice color. Bitterness at the end.
Sweet and smooth.  Dont sence any alcohol in this one.  Closer to curmudgeon than any other barleywine.  Otherwise does not taste like anything else.

Bottle, vintage 2009, many thanks to Cunningham. Ugly brown colored beer with minimal white head. Aroma of sweet malts, fruits, syrup, wood, dates, figs. Taste, sweet malt, brandy, apples, red fruits. Fruity finish. Alcohol is hardly recognized.  Very tasty beer.

2011 version. Pours a hazy brown/copper color with a 1/4 inch tan head. Aroma has a strong Maris otter malt aspect with a some light fruity notes, light raisin and anise, modest earthy hops presence and a modest sweet caramel malt finish. Flavor starts off with raisin and moves into a bitter earthy hops, light leather, strong earthy and finishes with a sweet caramel malt presence. Body is hefty with very low carbonation and a modest sugary feeling. Overall a pretty good. The sweetness it a bit on the high side but its very well rounded as a whole.

March 24, 2013 - bottle from Booze Mart.  Semi-opaque brown pour with nice amount of head that faded relatively quickly.  Give it a gentle swirl and the head really foams up.  Aroma was bready, caramel, dark fruit, alcohol, touch of spice and maybe some vanilla.  Taste was consistent with aroma, caramel up front, moves into the alcohol and dark fruit, then finishes with some bitterness and dry alcohol.  Relatively smooth and medium bodied.  2012 bottle.

2009 bottle pours fairly clear dark brown with soft drink type of head.  Aroma dark fruits.  Taste sweet malts with dark fruits progressing to honey/butterscotch.  Hops totally gone by this point, finish mainly the lingering grape and butterscotch.  Palate thick and a bit slippery.  A little alcohol burn.  Generally the butterscotch is considered a negative but it didnt detract too much.

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Boozy and malty. A little sweet but still tasty. Should have aged this a bit. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wonderfully sophisticated English style old ale.

Nose and flavor of apples, grapes, port, sherry, caramel, toffee, and pears in brandy.

Syrupy and yet almost ethereal body which is mouth-coating, and yet paradoxically sprightly.

Incredible execution of an old ale that will, undoubtedly become even more stupendous with age.

Serving type: bottle

Bottle from 10. Poured a nice mahogany shade with decent lacing and head retention. Nose was caramel, toast, chocolate, sweet plum, and nuts. Mouthfeel was very smooth on this one with minimal carbonation. Pretty warming in the belly. Would like to try this again. Cheers.
08 vintage, BIG thanks to Tewari.  Cloudy garnet, small tan head.  Sweet, some toffee and oxidation.  Pretty good.
On draught at Lucky Labrador Barleywine and Big Beer Festival. 2012 vintage. Grape and apple aroma. Grape juice, caramel, and light hoppiness in the taste. Finishes surprisingly smooth.

Bouteille 12oz (2004), courtoisie de Hogtownharry ou Blankboy. De couleur ambrée-rouge foncée et voilée. Nez fruité (petits fruits confits), de caramel toffee sucré, moyen-léger dalcool liquoreux , léger de houblon terreux (notes résineuses) et de sucre brun avec des notes épicées et de noix. Ronde en bouche avec un pétillement doux-moyen et une texture crémeuse et aux notes liquoreuses. Goût moyennement amer de houblon légèrement citrique et aux notes résineuses et herbeuses (une amertume présente en arrière-goût toute la gorgée) ainsi quun léger goût fruité (petits fruits confits, notes de raisins vineux) avec de faibles notes épicées lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût sucré de caramel toffee légèrement rôti, moyen de sucre brun avec en fond des petites notes de mélasse. Parallèlement, lon retrouve un goût réchauffant dalcool légèrement liquoreux (aux petites notes brûlantes) et ce jusquen finale, où lamertume de houblon devient plus herbeuse.  Post-goût long, moyennement amer dalcool, moyen de houblon herbeux aux notes résineuses avec des notes rôties ainsi que des traces fruitées.
2012. So so so sweet. Dessert beer. Amazingly sweet. Stilton or some smelly strong cheese - appetizer beer. Strong alcoholic sweetness with a complex barleywine aroma - light raisin and some caramel.
12 ounce bottle drank at the Bras Tap poured an amber color with aromas of dark fruit, caramel, light booze and some malt.  Flavors are the same, a nice everyday barleywine that anyone could enjoy.

Huge fan of the north coast brewery. This is an inbetween pranqster an old Rasputin. Full body. Strong flavor

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A sipping and savoring beer. Dark brown, slightly cloudy. Sweet, nutty, dried fruit flavors. Rich. Medium full body. Not an everyday thirst quencher, more in the after-dinner category.

2012... Pours very nice red with a dissipating tannish head. Aroma of alcohol dominates for me. Other aromas kind of weak. Dont taste much, kind of disappointing. Will try this one again tomorrow, because something isnt right with me.

Vinös doft som drar åt melass, soja, torkade plommon och en sötaktig honungston. Även lite kemisk schampoton förnimms.
En stor, söt smak med inslag av banan och malt. Känner också toner av belgisk jäst och aning bränt socker. Ingen humle alls.
Mahognyfärg med ett snabbt försvinnande, läskartat skum.
Riktigt bra munkänsla och en fyllighet som höjer känslan.
Precis när man sväljer ringer whiskytoner medan den korta eftersmaken är torvaktig, lätt rökig och torr med viss elegans.

This stuff pours golden brown with a gimongous head.  The aroma is hoppier than many barley wines, but with the expected, musky kind of honey and malt notes.  The flavor is just tremendous.  The  sweetness in the front is followed by a really creamy, sweet malt, some tingle, and a huge, rich exhale.  The mouthfeel is really big, really sticky.  Some barley wines can be cloying, but this one isnt at all.   But it is rich and strong enough to hide any hide that almost 12% ABV.

12 oz 2012 bottle pours a clear ruby brown with a disappearing 1 finger tan head but some lacing.  Smells of dark fruits, yeast, and caramel.  Aroma is the same, but also includes bananas, toffee, vanilla, and brown sugar.  Theres quite a lot going on here.  Taste is sweet with a slighly boozy finish but I couldnt detect the hops.  Body is medium to full with average carbonation or less.  This one rates right up there with some of the better barrel-aged barley wines Ive tried.

Poured a perfect mahogany color with a nice off white head, impressive for the ABV. Aroma hits you huge with sweetness of burnt caramel dark pitted fruits, and toffee and if I didnt know it wasnt would swear it was aged in bourbon barrels. Taste is sweet up front with the buttery toffee followed by bourbon and dark fruits and finishing with the heat of alcohol, not at all bad at almost 12% ABV. Mouthfeel is incredibly smooth, soft carbonation with a nice dry finish.

Dark ruby brown pour with half a finger of cream colored head. Smells of sweet yeasty, almost reminiscent of a Belgian, brown sugar, caramel, banana. Booze quick at first that quickly gives way to a really nice sweet caramel brown sugar esque taste. Yeastiness of a Belgian and some of the fruit notes as well. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2009 vintage


A - Poured into an over sized wine glass. Pours a nice cherry wood color. 1 finger tan head that vanishes fairly quickly.

S - Soy sauce, boozy malt, candied fig, cherry, prunes, all kinds of fruit. Its hard to distinct. 

T - Brown sugary fig, syrupy raisin, sweet toasted malt, nice spice in the middle, a little soapy towards the finish. Thick and sticky.

Very sugary sweet fruit flavor and thats about it. Wasnt extremely enjoyable and I dont see myself seeking this one out any time soon. I might age the one I have left to see if I drank it to soon.

Serving type: bottle

Skunky aroma of corn, flaked rice and resin. Deep crimson with a copper tint and thin foam rim. Odd, funky flavors of dates, raisins, brown sugar and booze. Overall, certainly interesting and unique but doesnt quite float my boat. Id give this a B rating.

2012 bottle to tulip glass.  Pours a hazy brown with some orange mixed in.  Aroma is malt with a definite sweetness, dark fruits and some buttery caramel.  Taste is initially some alcohol with a syrupy sweetness giving way to a bit of hops bitterness and malty caramel taste towards the end.  Creates quit an explosion of taste on the tongue.  About a quarter of the way through I started to notice more of a roasted taste that stuck to the tongue along with the faint bitterness.  Mouthfeel is slightly syrupy with a little alcohol burn and good carbonation.  Leaves a dry aftertaste.  Overall, not a fan of the sweetness but its not a deal breaker.  Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured a dark copper with ruby highlights into a snifter.  Two fingers of off white head that settles to a nice film and laces well.  Raisin and plum aroma with some grape skin and a touch of sherry like booziness.  Dark, ripe fruit flavor with some caramel sweetness.  Bready mid palate with roasted malt and some booziness that adds spice and warms going down.  Very little bitterness. Medium mouthfeel that is sweet but not cloying and somewhat sticky.  Semi high carbonation.  Very nice barleywine that hides its higher ABV well and has nice fruit and malt flavors.  Good sipper on a cold day. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 vintage. Pours a rich copper color with a finger of eggshell colored foam. The nose is full and layered. Nice toffee, caramel and straw. The palate follows nicely with a little more complexity. Dark fruits mingle with boozy soft sherry notes and brown sugar.  Nice bitterness creeps in on the backend.

The older it gets, the better. Within reason of course. Having just had the '09 at a local beer fest, this 2012 is excellent, if young. It ages very well, mellowing and rounding out. Still, brand new, it's pretty dang tasty!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a light brown color, almost copper. Aroma is strong malts, somewhat boozy, but the taste is smoother than I expected. Malts dominate, really sweet. Becomes thicker while drinking it, and somewhat more boozy as it warms.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Winterfest. Very sweet caramel flavor. Some booziness, but still very easy drinking with a slightly spicy finish. Old ale is really becoming a favorite style of mine. Sorry for the vague review, but I was very busy that day.

Golden amber pour with a medium white head. Smells sweet with caramel booziness; almost smells bourbon aged even though I dont think it is. smooth taste, wow. Caramel from the nose is heavy up front on taste. Hops are very subdued, but provide some balance. Alcohol is hidden very very well. coats the mouth nicely, overall a pretty well balanced ale, that I would definitely drink again.

Bourbon/sour aroma. Citrus hop aroma present. Malty sweetness gives way to sour flavor. Dark pit fruit taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Här blev jag nog lite besviken, inte för att den är dålig utan snarare för att jag hade höga förväntningar. Ölen är väldigt kraftig både till kropp och till alkohol med en lång utdragen efterbeska. Smaken är lite för spritig, för min smak, med toner av karamell och torkad frukt.

Reviewed 12/29/2012.12 oz bottle into a pint glass.

A: Pours a very dark brown color with low clarity and even a bit of opacity. The head is impressive for damn near 12% - a one finger light mocha color with a pretty texture and excellent retention for the gravity. Good lacing, too.

S: Very forward in sweet caramel, brown sugar, chocolate, and molasses. The booze that comes through almost has a bourbon character to it which I find to be very pleasing.

T: Wow, this is sweet, just as I expected. The usual suspects - brown sugar, caramel, molasses, chocolate, and toffee - all appear vibrant on the initial taste. I can notice earthen malts/hops and a more expressive note of vinous sourness on the midtaste, which not only dries out the huge sweetness, but does a good job, too. Finish is a hybrid of dark fruits, vanilla, leather and bourbon-esque booziness, though every so often it will shift from being like bourbon to being port-like (less vanilla and more raisin and grape). With a bit more tannin presence, this could almost pass for a BA brew at times. Overall complexity is subtle instead of forceful; the latter could have just as easily killed this one, and Im glad it didnt. Not super drinkable, but wonderful to savor.

M: I think the carbonation could be a little less forceful (not necessarily weaker, though) This is actually fairly clean and dry at first, but becomes a little more oily and lingering after a few sips. A bit airy and insubstantial; its not as decadent as I would have liked, and doesnt quite do the flavor profile justice. Still, this is less harsh than it could have been - but I think a year in the cellar would do it wonders.

O: Better than I expected. Its actually pretty damn drinkable right now! If the mouthfeel was beefed up some, this really could have been something unbelievable. As it stands, its still an excellent old ale. Seemingly lacking in frills, it instead chooses to sneak up on the palate with a wonderful - if not readily apparent at first - depth of flavor and complexity. Wish I bought more than a single...

02.01.13. Bottle. Not much foam, beige color though. The beer is a clear, dark copper. Aroma of some yeast, sweet, malty, some berries. Taste consists of a bit of coffee, alcohol, dryish bitter. Creamy mouthfeel. Warming alcohol & bitter finish.I would have hoped for sweetness in the flavor. Nasty bitterness. Not for me.

Kaatuu Leskisen pikkutuoppiin likaisenruskeana, sameana ja melkein vaahdottomana. Haju on hyvin makean karamellinen, siirappinen, marjainen ja tumman hedelmäinen. Maku on jälleen makea, alkoholinen, tumman hedelmäinen, siirappinen ja leipäisen maltainen. Suutuntuma on täyteläinen ja lämmittävä, alkoholi tuntuu kyllä. Kokonaisuutena tämä jää vaisuksi tuotokseksi, alkoholi tuntuu omaan makuun aivan turhan paljon. Yömyssyksi saattaisi sopia viskin/konjakin korvikkeena.

2012 vintage.  12 oz bottle.  Pours a reddish-brown and is just a bit cloudy.  Off-white head leaves quickly and leaves behind no lacing.  Average carbonation.  Caramelized malts and dark fruits aromas.  Sweet, malty, alcoholic and inviting.  Chewy, thick and syrupy mouth feel.  Strong and sweet malt flavor.  Boozy.  Very light hop bitterness.  Finishes sweet and strong with a bit of spice.  Complex and interesting.  Perhaps I should age one of these.

2010 Vintage 12 oz bottle drank very differently tonight compared to when I imbibed in 2010. This poured vibrant amber with an audible crack from the carbonation then it quickly went flat (but drank sparkly). Aroma is like a rich ruby port and a sweet cola. Flavor notes of brown sugar, molasses and specialty malt with a slight jolt from alcohol warming. Barely medium-lean in body. Drinkable and refined.

Bottle 0.335l from Oluthuone Leskinen, Oulu. Vintage 2009. Colour is brown with small brownish white head. Aromas and flavours are spices, caramel, dark fruits, plum and malts. Alcohol is well hidden. Not too sweet.

This was a great beer.  Reminded me of the Belgian Trappist stuff.  Nice alcohol content and very smooth.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ruby pour with thin tan head. Slightest caramel aroma - good but not very aromatic. Great taste with light, sweet body. Fuggles hops bring a british hop taste to the mix that is nothing short of fantastic
One of my personal favorites to drink.  So it had to be my first rate!

Pours amber gold with no head. Aroma of sweet caramel malt and peppery yeast. Taste follows rich malty and sweet. Tasty dessert beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I'm celebrating tonight with with this fine Old Stock. It very possibly will taste better in a few years, but I'm enjoying this rich and malty beer tonight. I might like a little more hops to balance with the malt, but that might be the next beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Absolutely delicious old ale/barleywine style.  The other reviews youll read here sum it up nicely with my only addition being this was a 2012 vintage.

2011 vintageCloudy amber colur with a small off white head that soon vanish. Sweeeet fruity aroma (not overkill sweet. Full body and a bit sweet, light bitter. Maybee to cold at start. Really sweet after a while. Rich balanced sweet and fruity flavour. Very well hidden alcohol and smooth carbonation.[Bottle from a trade with Gunnar]

(2011 vintage) Garnet-colored beverage topped by a rapidly disappearing off-white/yellow-ish head. What remains is you, a tiny ring of foam and that red brew that you anxiously smell. Brown sugar, treacle (someone mentionned toffee but I couldnt feel it)  is what strikes you first. And then you still search and you find some alcoholic notes and nothing else... bummer. Carbonation is a little higher than Id like but it doesnt bother me that much, really as it makes the mouth feel bigger (ample). Taste is again brown sugar without a discernible bitterness. What you can feel though is all the alcohol warmth and sting. I thought it would be more complex than it is but it is still a good, big barleywine.

2012 vintage, 12 oz. bottle, poured into a nonic glass. 

It pours a dark red with minimal tan lacing. The first sniff gives carmel, oak, and some toasted malts. The flavor brings out heavy, fruity hops, balanced by the smoky malts.
